Review.Titre: They didn't help me at all in resolving…
Review.Contenu: They didn't help me at all in resolving the conflict or instructing the other party that he had not listed his device correctly. They basically said "you guys work it out yourselves".There aren't any FAQ's about returning items or any systems set up to follow the progress of returned items as there are with purchases. The main webpages are built from the purchase perspective. They need to imagine what it is like to be customer having to deal with a deceitful seller and then develop a seamless return process. Tracking is needed. I am relying on the seller to refund my money once he receives the item back. No way to follow the progress or enforce this event.

Review.Titre: No guarantee you will get paid…”What is happening with Swappa?”

Review.Titre: No guarantee you will get paid…”What is happening with Swappa?”

Swappa’s reply was - “Not our problem”. Apparently Swappa doesn’t give two cents about your money. All they care about is getting their cut. After that, they will not help you get paid.

Don’t trust swappa and definitely don’t trust Pdx cellular solutions!

Review.Contenu: Bought an iPhone from a seller and they didn't ship within Swappa's required two day shipping window and stopped communicating. Swappa can't/doesn't do anything but beg the seller for a refund, Swappa can't require sellers to do anything. Swappa support staff is barely responsive, not providing initiative, sympathy, or guidance (when they can even be bothered to reply).The seller then gives only a partial refund, making excuses like they did for not shipping. Had to go through PayPal to get the rest of my money, took a week and some phone calls. How does that make Swappa any different/better than eBay or anywhere else you could pay with PayPal?

Review.Titre: some scam to be aware of
Review.Contenu: I got scammed here today. Bought an iphone and 36 minutes after paying Swappa sent me the following message: "this seller has been removed from our service. Unfortunately at this time, I recommend you file a PayPal dispute to begin the forced refund process: Login to PayPal, locate and click on the payment sent to the seller, and then click on the "Report a problem" link. From there, you can file a dispute."When I asked for more details I got: "we do not have additional details to share at this time."When I asked how they knew to cancel and remove the seller I got no response. I guess it is a mystery. Another interesting thing is the listing shows "sold", but my invoice shows "cancelled" and apparently no more help than what you read. $633 tied up for weeks in dispute resolution, no iphone, and some jerk is enjoying themselves. So much for "No junk, No jerks". Give it some thought.Update: I resent my question and did get another response from them, but it is nothing helpful: "We are not able to give out specific information when a user is removed from the site." I only wish they could explain how 36min after I paid they knew it was a scam and not before they approved the listing.

Review.Titre: Banded by Swappa for asking for support
Review.Contenu: The iPhone i was received had screen damaged not shown in the picture and not disclosed in the description (SellWorld from NJ).  I exchanged multiple messages with the sell explaining the issue and asking for return instructions. The sell finally said that the picture in the listing isn't required to be the actual product being sold. That is why the screen damage was not shown. Furthermore, the phone still works with screen damage, so they would not take it back.  I reached at to Swappa to help moderate and resolve the issue. Their slogan is the "safe place to buy used electronics."  Instead of helping me, they responded they don't resolve disputes and it is between me and the seller. Then Heather K. from Swappa "restricted" by account.  All this to save basically $200 on a used iPhone. I've learned my lesson, don't deal with these sites. I thought eBay was bad, by Swappa was managed to lower the bar. Well done.

Review.Titre: I purchased a brand new Pixel Watch…

I spent a considerable amount of time trying various methods to pair it with my phone, but nothing worked.When I contacted the seller to request a return, I was met with resistance. Instead of accepting responsibility for selling a faulty product, the seller insisted that I contact Google Support. They informed me that Google Support needed to verify that the watch was indeed not functioning properly before accepting the return.To make matters worse, my experience with Swappa's customer support was equally frustrating. I was connected with three different representatives in the chat, but none of them provided any solutions. Instead, they left me to fend for myself in a dispute with the seller.Overall, my experience with this seller, as well as Swappa's customer support, has been incredibly disappointing and unhelpful. I would caution anyone considering a purchase from this seller to think twice, as their commitment to customer satisfaction and support is severely lacking

Review.Contenu: Had the misfortune of buying a phone from GM Deals. Phone was advertised as unlocked and in "excellent condition" Came locked and extremely poor condition. Got a refund though. (Swappa rocks though.)

Review.Titre: After selling lightly used Apple gear…
Review.Contenu: After selling lightly used Apple gear on eBay for years, I thought I might look for an alternate venue this year as there seem to be a lot of fraudulent buyers on eBay these days and the company is not doing enough to control it. After some web searching I decided to set up an account on Swappa. I photographed my mint condition iPhone 14 Pro, wrote up a description and listed it for sale. But then I got a message telling me that the listing was not live and that Swappa needed additional information. Their site said I needed to write the listing number down and photograph it with the item. The iPhone was already packaged for shipping but, OK, I took it out of the box and photographed it with the item number on a piece of paper. Then I submitted it for review and.....nothing. Two days later I get a message (with zero explanation) telling me the listing was cancelled. When I inquired as to why, I was told the item had to be turned on and facing the camera with the item number next to it. I obviously would have done that had they just, you know, provided those instructions on their site. Man, what a pedantic hassle and a waste of time. At that point I was just too annoyed to go any further, thinking that if I kept jumping through hoops they would continue to add more. This was my first and last experience trying to sell anything on Swappa. Since my name isn't Marvin the Mindreader I guess Swappa isn't the place for me.

Review.Titre: avoid if you are a seller
Review.Contenu: I would strongly caution against anyone using Swappa to sell items. As a seller, you have no way to prevent persons outside the U.S. from purchasing your items (or from persons residing in US overseas territories). Even if you expressly state in your listing that you will only ship to US buyers residing in the CONUS, there is no way to prevent overseas buyers from purchasing items via freight forwarding services. This is important because of increased costs and risks to sellers that their goods will be lost, stollen, or damaged if the goods are sent overseas (on swappa, the sellers are responsible for all shipping costs). Not to mention buyers who might be trying to use a freight-forwarding service to circumvent US export sanctions controlsSwappa support has proved to be extremely unhelpful and slow. There is no phone or chat support and trying to cancel a transaction and issue a refund to buyers you deem an unacceptably high-risk is a nightmare.

Review.Titre: BUYERS & SELLERS BEWARE
Review.Contenu: I thought Swappa was awesome, up until it came time for PayPal to release my money from the buyer. Had I have known that PayPal would put a 21 day hold on my money, and then tell me the hold would be released in 24 hours upon delivery of item but  then tell me I have to wait 21 days even though I did everything asked of me. I even shipped it 2nd Day Air paying $35 extra out of pocket so the item would get to the buyer in a speedy manner. The Buyer gave me 5 stars and even complimented me on the speed of shipping it. But Swappa won't do a damn thing about it now. Because of this negative experience with PayPal, it's totally tainted my view about Swappa. I will never use Swappa nor PayPal again, Ever!

Review.Titre: I had two miserable experiences on this…
Review.Contenu: I had two miserable experiences on this site that caused me to completely delete my account. I purchased two phones on Swappa, in both cases they needed to be returned immediately. The first phone did not work, at all. The seller was fine with the return. The second phone came in horrible shape and wasn't compatible with my network. This seller refused any returns whatsoever, despite the product not as described. The phone, according to Verizon when I called them, was likely stolen and resold with a balance due on it. That meant I basically bought a brick.Swappa allows you to check a box so they can see the customer/business interactions, however they do nothing to actually help on the buyer side. This is a site that gives refuge to sellers selling stolen electronics, broken junk,etc., and there is virtually nothing you can do as a buyer if you are unlucky enough to buy one of these devices. It is the wild west. If you have a good experience, great. But if you don't you are out of luck.As far as prices go, eBay is very similar, and has more buyer protection. Go there. Trust me, you do not want to have issues on Swappa.

Review.Titre: False Advertising is ok Here
Review.Contenu: Bought a phone that said it would only have a aftermarket screen and charger. Was guaranteed to have a battery health of 89% or better. I was ok with that. Got the phone and I can’t check the battery health because the battery is aftermarket as well so I can’t verify the battery health guarantee. The description never said anything about the battery being aftermarket or I would have never bought it. was gonna just have the battery replaced for a true apple part but the company only offered me $20 vs the $70 that it would cost to have the battery replaced at the Apple Store. I was offered a return/exchange but I did decline due to the fact I was in no position to be without a phone for work and I would probably just get another phone with a aftermarket battery. So a return was not an option for me. Swappa support was no help. Will never use this site again.

Review.Titre: Buyers world- Sellers don’t matter
Review.Contenu: Overall the experience was not pleasant. The buyer commented and asked about shipping during a work day, I didn’t get an opportunity to comment as I work a full time job. I was given a 5 hr window to respond. When going to respond I was banned due to not responding in a timely manner. This was on a Monday. The customer purchased the item on a Friday afternoon, which based on the shipping Policy I had until Tuesday to ship and add tracking information. I dropped the package off at 7:20 Monday night. due to me not responding within the five hour window during my work day, the buyer was instructed to make a report via PayPal to say the item was not shipped. Now here we are a few days after the product was delivered I still have not had the payment released from PayPal but the customer has received the iPad and I was able to confirm it was received from UPS tracking. So all around Swappa is clearly on the buyers side- and doesn’t care about the seller since I had to email 4 times in order to get a response after seeing I was banned. I was then unbanned when I asked how I violated the policies and they did not have a valid reason since I was able to show proof that the iPad went out for delivery the day before it was even required

Review.Titre: BUYER BEWARE OF SWAPPA AND CHEAP PHONES USA!
Review.Contenu: I cannot recommend Swappa because of a bad experience with one of its sellers, Cheap Phones USA.  I purchased  a phone from Cheap Phones USA through Swappa (SXFK36879) on 5/21/23. It was lost in the mail. When I finally received it on June 2, 2023, it was defective.  You could not talk and listen w/o toggling back and forth to the speaker.  I was told to reset the phone.  That did not work.  Cheap Phones USA then admitted that the phone "did need a replacement speaker so that part may not be working."  Absolutely, it did not work.  So, I returned the phone in a the same padded envelope with the label emailed to me. Afterwards I received a message from Cheap Phones USA that they would not refund my money ($108.15) because the back glass and front screen were damaged.  When I put the phone in the mail, it was not damaged!  Cheap Phones USA sells cheap and defective phones.  They also do not refund customers.  Based on this horrible experience and losing over $100, I urged Swappa to discontinue business with Cheap Phones USA or intercede for me.  Swappa did not help me, but sent a quick "too bad" message.Buyer Beware!  DO NOT BUY A USED PHONE ONLINE THROUGH SWAPPA!

Review.Titre: forwarding/reshipping
Review.Contenu: As a buyer, I believe that SWAPPA is not very fair to people who use forwarding/reshipping services because we are always required to ask the seller if they are willing to ship their merchandise to such addresses. This causes us to wait for the seller's response, during which another buyer might beat us to purchasing the product. Additionally, in many cases, sellers become wary because they perceive risks associated with forwarding/reshipping. While it is true that risks exist, it should be taken into consideration that in the year 2023, risk is something that is present everywhere.I use forwarding/reshipping services, and there have been many instances where a 100% American seller tries to scam me by not sending the item or providing an invalid tracking number. I understand that having to ask the seller before making a purchase if they are willing to ship to a forwarding/reshipping address is somewhat discriminatory and unfair to us buyers.I also believe that SWAPPA should allow sellers to leave feedback for buyers, or at the very least, allow those buyers with a certain number of purchases and length of membership to make purchases without having to ask beforehand.

Review.Titre: Have been selling on Swappa for over a…
Review.Contenu: Have been selling on Swappa for over a decade, and it's gone so far downhill I don't think I'll continue to sell through this website anymore.Recently sold a phone that had hiccups with tracking numbers (that were well out of my hands and fixed fairly quickly) to an individual that let the phone sit in the mail for 5 days and then decided to accuse me of committing fraud multiple times because someone in his family picked up the phone and he didn't even realize it. I got a PayPal case started against me for no reason (which froze my account) and was berated by the buyer and continuously accused of never shipping the phone or somehow manipulating USPS shipping numbers. What's hilarious is that the numbers I provided the buyer clearly showed the delivery date/etc., so there was no reason for any of this to happen. I reach out to Swappa staff during the process and get a copy-pasted paragraph, and that's it. No actual help or intermediation whatsoever. I reached out again, and GOT THE SAME EXACT COPY PASTED PARAGRAPH from the first time. Hours later, the buyer comes clean and drops the PayPal case and admits he had actually received the phone. I ask Swappa staff for some type of punitive action for the buyer since the buyer has made defamatory statements and caused issues with my PayPal account, and Swappa staff simply says:"It appears that the case with PayPal was resolved and that the buyer did receive the device. This was a clear issue on the buyers part, however we cannot penalize the buyer for their mistake on this part. We will notate their account regarding the sale and watch for any future behavior."So it would seem that there are near zero repercussions for buyers who act like this?? Combine this nightmare of an experience with Swappa's MASSIVELY increased fees over the years, and you have a marketplace that I can barely consider viable anymore. Swappa, you truly used to be great, now you've absolutely fallen by the wayside. P.S., if your staff could actually respond to my email asking why you openly allow libel from buyers on your site, that would be great. Still haven't heard back! Truly seems like you can't be bothered to do anything to support your sellers.

Review.Titre: Shame on you Swappa!
Review.Contenu: Shame on you, Swappa! Have bought over 20 phones on Swappa since 2016. Always loved my experiences, until this last one. I'm not super "techy", and admittedly don't understand all about networks and unlocked phones. Bought an unlocked phone, and upon receipt quickly noticed it can't be used with Verizon. I had used a Google search's 1st hit info to define "unlocked" (my bad, I guess), which said unlocked phones can be used with any carrier of choice. Phone wouldn't recognize sim upon arrival. Went through particular heck, costing me tons of time and money to try to figure out why it wouldn't work. Seller repeatedly tried to convince me it could be used, and that Verizon was giving me false info. Like, why would they?? Swappa was no support, and I had to ask them to step in, even tho I had checked their little box for them to be involved in all of our comments (I had a feeling things would go south with seller). When I asked in a comment for Swappa to step in (because they weren't about to otherwise), they immediately jumped to seller's defense. Now seller will accept a return if I pay for return shipping. No thanks. I've lost enough money on this useless phone already. In my opinion, Swappa needs to recognize that not everyone understands all the "techy" stuff and jargon. In my opinion, when an "unlocked" phone is being purchased, Swappa should help the buyer understand the risks associated, and a pop-up or something should alert the buyer to check the IMEI with their carrier. I didn't understand all of this before, but I do now. Was an expensive education! Swappa could really help their buyers AND sellers, with a little bit of upfront support! Would that really be that hard? All you are is a glorified middleman, collecting your fees, but not actually being of help to anyone. Used to be different. Shame on you Swappa! I believe I'm done with you, since you are basically useless anyway. Sad, so many years of good experiences, and you were willing to just wave goodbye as the door hit me in the butt, on my way out. Should have stood by your good principles, instead of selling out to the "don't care" entitled crowd.**Added after Swappa response: Yep. Just like I said in my review, why would I want to pay to return it, after all the expenses I've already been thru? But this review is about you, Swappa, and the fact that you don't offer info for "dummies" that don't know or understand all this techie stuff. You used to have it together, Swappa, but now you're pretty much useless. Your sole purpose is only to take money from sales. No point.

Review.Titre: Money talks and Swappa listens and ignores loyal patrons…
Review.Contenu: Swappa has shown unreasonable and unwarranted partiality towards a very dishonest SELLER who listed a used, damaged product as NEW and sold to me. I have no idea why Swappa has chosen to side with this Seller apart from they don’t want to lose the proceeds from the sale if it is canceled.I’ve been a loyal Swappa SELLER/BUYER for a number of years. I have a perfect 5-star rating and have never made a fuss about anything.UPDATE after Swappa's ridiculously inaccurate and very biased (once again) response:"There was an issue with this purchase that warranted a return with a full refund, or a partial refund. You and the seller initially agreed to a $75 partial refund, and then you attempted to double that to $150 after the seller did not respond as quickly as you expected."The Seller only agreed to a $75 partial refund after 4 days of non-responsiveness during which I had to deal with PayPal for hours on end to start the dispute process. At that point, I was fed up with his antics and upped the refund to $150 but then brought it back down to $75. PLEASE TELL THE WHOLE TRUTH SWAPPA AND STOP SIDING WITH THE SELLER!"We also took issue with the fact you were using the device and delaying the return until your next phone purchase arrived, which you confirmed to us via email."So you take issue with me using the phone but you don't take issue with the Seller being non-responsive after he listed and sold a USED/DAMAGED phone as NEW for over $1,000?!?!I explained to the Swappa rep why I was using the phone because after I had won the bid for this Seller’s phone, I listed and sold my only phone (ON SWAPPA!!) and this used/damaged phone was the only device I had to use in the meanwhile but the Seller was very slow and delayed in response.Beyond this, the Seller was using profanity and responding with rude, accusatory language/words and Swappa never took issue with his inappropriate language/words. But of course, Swappa took issue with me when I simply tried to speak logically/frankly. I have the screenshots of the correspondences..it was rather UNREAL how BIASED Swappa acted against me.Here's but a few examples and let's let the reader decide who was biased and in the wrong...but nice try Swappa.How about admitting to your bias/wrong and simply apologizing? Not sure I'll ever be using your platform again.WsKmisc Buyer - Apr 30, 2023 - 08:30 PMUmmm...is this Swappa policy or guideline? If so, show me where because my time has been quite wasted.If Ryan isn't ok with it, send me a return label and I'll get it sent right back. Sheesh.Dale K Staff - Apr 30, 2023 - 09:14 PMWsKmisc, we don't allow strong arming people into a higher refund. You already said you would accept $75. Now saying you'll only accept $150 or demand a refund is not appropriate.If you simply would just prefer a return for a refund due to the condition, that's fine but $75 was the amount you said you initially wanted and your seller agreed.WsKmisc Buyer - Apr 30, 2023 - 09:22 PMI'm not strong-arming anyone or anything. Judge much, Dale? For whatever reason, you are exhibiting tremendous partiality towards Ryan.If I didn't have to spend over 2 hours calling and working with PayPal to get the dispute started up, and if I hadn't sold my own device, then all would be somewhat fine but a lot of time and effort has been wasted.Yes, I would simply prefer a full refund for a return of the device. Thanks.

Ive had numerous shipping delays with usps and swappa doesnt do much to help cover sellers except tell them to file a claim with the carrier. Also swappa needs to be VERY transparent about buyer and seller fees. All the buyers who comment on my sales dont seem to understand why a device listed for 300 has a listing price of 320-330. Transaction fees are doubled by swappa and paypal so maybe make another payment option available such as zelle or venmo or cashapp or something that doesnt cost the seller and buyer so much.

Review.Titre: Swappa no help
Review.Contenu: Individual seller was good but had a slight problem with delivery. Swappa offered absolutely no help at all, not even advice.

Review.Titre: Well its my first time ordering from…
Review.Contenu: Well its my first time ordering from swappa and the phone seriel number reports it as stolen or lost. Got in touch with seller and is working on the issue. Other than that it came in a timely manner and as described. Hopefully it works out and can Give better review

Review.Titre: Would not recommend. Petty moderators frustrate all
Review.Contenu: While I understand your need to keep all communications between Buyers and Sellers within the Swappa domain, just deleting long messages is incredibly annoying and unacceptable. In my case, it was innocent.While I understand your high-level need to keep language clean, I used the phrase, "I appreciate the seller helping me with my f'-up." (f'-up was spelled out) in a longer message and it was also deleted.  Both of these are symptoms of an immature organization that does not understand the difference between managing commerce and unnecessarily adding friction and angering customers and sellers.  Suggestion: Simply replace phone numbers, emails,  and any salty language with asterisks and a comment of "Deleted by Swappa per policy".  That is what Craigslist does and they have been doing this since the 90's.I would not recommend Swappa.

Review.Titre: Unfortunately my phone was stolen…
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately my phone was stolen enroute to me. The seller was a champ and eventually refunded. Swappa staff fumbled: was not nice is response (didn't seem to care much), gave me incorrect instructions, and no information on a refund timeline.

Review.Titre: Swappa failed to mention that PayPal…
Review.Contenu: Swappa failed to mention that PayPal would be taking a big chunk of my payout. The bottomline laid out by Swappa was therefore incorrect.

Review.Titre: Using PayPal is a huge disadvantage to…
Review.Contenu: Using PayPal is a huge disadvantage to swappa. There are fees on fees on fees. And if you are new you have to wait 21 days to get your money. Then there is a cash out limit. All on PayPal’s side but it’s the only payment option

Review.Titre: Swappa USED to be the one-stop / No hassle
Review.Contenu: Swappa USED to be the one-stop, no hassle place to buy / sell phones.   Now they pass off the shipping / payment to outside services (who add ANOTHER fee) and they haven't bothered to get API working to pass info BACK, like payment status, Ship info, etc.   Once they grab their "fee" they're done.    Still a good place to BUY from but be prapared to wait up to 3 WEEKS for payment.

Review.Titre: No charger problem
Review.Contenu: I bought a Galaxy S9 phone through Swappa. I was surprised to find the battery drained faster than the 2 year old A32 I was replacing. They offered to replace it under warranty, so I sent it back with the charger. When they returned the phone, the charger was missing. After 3 email follow ups, I got no response. I am quite disappointed.

Review.Titre: Hard To Start Selling
Review.Contenu: Getting started on the app is extremely difficult. I just started selling and haven't sold for months. Buying is great though-can't complain for that!

Review.Titre: Phone cannot be activated due to age of…
Review.Contenu: Phone cannot be activated due to age of phone and becoming obsolete.

Review.Titre: Wasn't really happy with the fees
Review.Contenu: Wasn't really happy with the fees. There should be an exact calculator that also includes the PayPal fees

Review.Titre: Swappa should require photos of actual item from everyone
Review.Contenu: Disappointed that swappa allows large quantity resellers to post file photos and not photos of the actual item.

Review.Titre: Purchased a phone from swappa
Review.Contenu: Purchased a phone from swappa. The buyer was friendly and everything. He did not tell me that the device was a pre-release promotional unit. There was no serial number on the box or anywhere only inside the phone. LONG story short, Google would not warranty the phone. The motherboard went out and needed to be replaced. They said that I could pay $350 and they would send me a refurbished one. Swappa didn't have any record of the serial number and also the phone had water damage which did not happen from me. Like my mom used to say, buyer beware.

Review.Titre: Swappa fee like ebay, but no service.
Review.Contenu: Swappa seller fee was attractive maybe half year ago, but now Swappa takes almost the same fee like ebay, but they don't do anything if something happens. They just send problems to paypal system while taking considerable money.  For a seller, swappa is not a good platform. I recently found that If you have a return/a scamming unauthorized chargeback, you don't get paypal fee back losing considerable money and also your item at the same time.  So, seller should be mindful about this kind of scammers(usually new swappa user; hit and run).

Review.Titre: I believe swapper prioritize some…
Review.Contenu: I believe swapper prioritize some sellers more than others some sellers are not required to have a code in their picture but others are there is several listing where there is not a code visible in the picture but yet they were approved for selling

Review.Titre: Swappa supports untruthful sellers
Review.Contenu: I have been using Swappa for over 5 years and this was the first time a seller is untruthful regarding an item. Even though Swappa had all the necessary evidence, they didn’t want to make a choice and pushed for the case to be decided by PayPal. I believe that was pretty weak on Swappa. I was lucky that I used PayPal and they ruled on my favor… no thanks to Swappa.

Review.Titre: Seller was good
Review.Contenu: Seller was good.  But Swappa's arcane rules and lack of help when needed is disturbing.  Seller purchased a phone with 256gb of storage plus a 256gb sd card.  To be fair, I missed the point where the seller wasn't going to include the 256 sd card.  However after asking about just reversing the sale Swappa says buyers remorse is a no go.  Really?  I know it was my fault.  But how difficult is it to just reverse it.  I found my error within minutes.  But nope.  We can't help you.

Review.Titre: Everything went smoothly, but…
Review.Contenu: Everything went smoothly, but as a first time seller on Swappa, I would’ve appreciated transparency on their part of all of the associated fees, seeing as $20 was deducted from my net sale amount for Paypal I’m guessing? I am not even clear to this day.

Review.Titre: Swappa is good, PayPal sucks!
Review.Contenu: I used Swappa for the first time to sell my Pixel 6 Pro phone. Before I even knew it had been sold, I received a text and email from PayPal saying my account had been banned for suspicious activity and violations of their terms of service. It took a week of calling and emailing their customer service, and sending copies of the receipt when I bought the phone from Google, the UPS tracking number when I shipped it, and explaining all the details of the transaction to reinstate my account.The experience with Swappa was ok, but I will never use them again if they require using PayPal.

Review.Titre: They've become what they hated
Review.Contenu: The fee system has evolved to what they said they weren't, they know there are no true selling alternatives for this niche because of the reputation they have built for themselves and now they are gouging those very same people that brought them to their current standing. I cannot wait for someone to launch an alternative to Swappa that reinforces Swappa's initial mission statement and is as seller friendly as they once were.

Review.Titre: Swappa USED to be a great
Review.Contenu: Swappa USED to be a great, trustworthy place to buy/sell phones. The last two phones I sold, listing them on Mercari, the responses to buy were very sketchy. Cancelled the first listing on Swappa bc I didn’t want to get scammed out of a phone. And 2nd one there were scammers that kept messaging and luckily one legit buyer came through and purchased it. Swappa is bottom tier, exactly same as eBay now in terms of trustworthiness.

Review.Titre: There are maybe half a dozen large…
Review.Contenu: There are maybe half a dozen large sellers on the site, I've had a bad experience with 1 of them 3 of 4 times that required sending the phone back, they weren't required to submit validation photos. The photos they submitted didn't even match the phone, at all. Not buying from that 1 seller eliminates what like 20% of the site for me. From now on I'll either buy from elsewhere or only from small sellers, which itself comes with more risk.

Review.Titre: Swappa could do better screening items for features.
Review.Contenu: Not the sellers fault. But the item was advertised by Swappa as having unlocked cellular capability. What I received was a item with wifi and Bluetooth only capability. I'm kind of upset about it... The seller was very helpful but it's not their fault and should not be held responsible for something Swappa should check.

Review.Titre: Not a great experience
Review.Contenu: As a seller I didn't really have any issues and my phone sold quickly. I do have a complaint that SWAPPA wasn't up front about shipping costs coming out of the seller's pocket. As a buyer, SWAPPA is pretty much worthless about doing anything about problems. They expect everything to be handled through PayPal which takes 3 months. When you need a phone you can't wait around for 3 months. They can sit and monitor a seller be rude and they don't do anything

Review.Titre: Poor
Review.Contenu: Swappa doesn't let you put a name on your shipping addresses. Unlike every other e-commerce business, they force the address to use the name on your paypal account. That's wrong when you ship to another person.I complained about this. The seller was understanding but the customer support blew me off.Also, I need to complete a capcha every few minutes of browsing on the site. Very annoying and not professional.

Review.Titre: Fees on Swappa are not clear
Review.Contenu: Fees on Swappa are not clear. You are given the impression that the buyer is solely responsible for any fees, then you, as a seller, see a “Partner Fee” on the PayPal transaction that you didn’t anticipate. For this reason I cannot recommend Swappa. They are no different than eBay when it comes to fees. Maybe a little cheaper, but not transparent.

Review.Titre: There was a problem with my order being…
Review.Contenu: There was a problem with my order being misrepresented. I asked Swappa staff to assist in the resolution process. They did next to nothing to help. They left me hanging. Very dialing in this experience. Other experiences were better. This one made me rethink my future use of Swappa.

Review.Titre: Swappa address issues
Review.Contenu: Ran into an issue with Swappa having an old address and forcing PayPal to use it, even when I unselected that address in the PayPal popup and was told I could change it in Swappa. I was forced to cancel the sale and wait a couple days to have the money refunded through the seller, minus a refund fee. I asked for Swappa to cover the $6 (!!!) in refund fees and they haven't done so as of yet.

Review.Titre: Purchased an item but didn't receive it…
Review.Contenu: Purchased an item but didn't receive it in the condition it was advertised. Swappa stepped in to correct the seller (which was good) and I got my money back.Unfortunately, Swappa did nothing when the seller didn't refund the return shipping and insurance. I brought it to Swappa's attention several times, and they could have easily made the seller refund me. They didn't, and I had to pay for someone else's mistake.Don't count on them to do the right thing.

Review.Titre: As a buyer BEWARE!!
Review.Contenu: I have always had great success buying and selling on Swappa until this last transaction where a seller sold a phone that that couldn’t be activated. The support swappa provided was absolutely terrible. Other than calling my credit card company for a charge back was the only option. Swappa did not support me as a buyer, I was out the money paid for a “bricked” phone. For this experience I will not be using Swappa again to buy items.

Review.Titre: Swappa Fails for buyer
Review.Contenu: I tried to purchase an iPad on swap recently, and failed two times.  Both times the seller backed out.  This never happens on Ebay!  Also, swappa support does not really intervene in refunds the way Ebay does.  They just punt it over to PayPal.  I am giving two stars because I did receive my refund eventually.

Review.Titre: From a buyer perspective
Review.Contenu: From a buyer perspective, alerts on comments are too slow. I just lost out on a purchase because of the slow response time from a comment posting and getting an alert. Instead you have to continually hit refresh if you are waiting for a price drop. To be clear, I'm all for a first come first serve policy. However, I shouldn't be getting a notice the device is sold before the comments that were posted 10 minutes earlier before the price drop happened. Thanks!

Review.Titre: Swappa staff are ineffective babysitters
Review.Contenu: Received a phone not as described. Seller was instructed by Swappa staff to reimburse return shipping, seller didn't, Swappa did nothing. I wouldn't put any faith in Swappa to ensure transactions go smoothly.Edit: the reply is a complete lie. The seller never refunded return shipping. Swappa was notified in comments and emails and did nothing to persuade the seller to follow Swappa's own rules.Additional Edit: Swappa staff was eventually able to motivate the seller to refund 35% of the return shipping cost. I would say Swappa deserves 40% of a 5 star review.

Review.Titre: You don’t get paid instantly
Review.Contenu: First time using this site to sell an iPhone. It was pretty easy up to the point of retrieving my money. If the buyer pays through PayPal, there will be a hold on the funds. Swappa advertises it as you get paid instantly, which is not the case. The phone was delivered 7 days ago and I’m still waiting on PayPal to release the funds. Customer service is very responsive and helpful.

Review.Titre: As a first time user
Review.Contenu: As a first time user, I chose Swappa because I wanted a safe transaction for both myself and the buyer. When I didn't notice one step of the process (recording the tracking number), Swappa representatives didn't give me the benefit of the doubt and were hostile, even though the buyer was sympathetic. They panicked when I didn't respond and had the buyer file a Paypal dispute, although it was 4am in my time zone. Thanks for nothing! Unnecessarily blemishing my financial record and hopefully I'll never have to sell a phone again.

Review.Titre: Not the best, not the worst
Review.Contenu: The platform is good for mass reach and the fees are good. But their ad validation service is ridiculously inconsistent.First time - just one pic with their ad number, one without - got approvedSecond time upload one side pic. Validation requested for the back pic. Got approved. No serial number required.Next item, uploaded pics of all 4 sides with ad number but then got rejected requiring serial number. It almost seems like they just want to block once and then approve. Same price range for all 3 items. Same item models - different colors and memory sizes.

Review.Titre: The fees are too damn high
Review.Contenu: Fees are too high, making this marketplace hardly more desirable than eBay. At least with eBay I have a much large market of potential buyers. Now that you have to charge sales tax, you should really lower the fees by at least 50%.Also add a feature that lets potential buyers send offers directly to the seller instead of clogging up the comments section.

Review.Titre: Swappa might be good for selling but they’re awful at verifying things
Review.Contenu: Swappa seemed to have no idea how to complete a sale. Looks like they’re not able to verify anything about the phones. And I had to deal with the customers entire problems that made no sense. I’m not gonna waste my time writing out what happened. Just look at the past sale that took 3 weeks to actually go through.

Review.Titre: WARNING: Maroon Mobile, LLC
Review.Contenu: I suspect Swappa warrants 4 or 5 stars; however, my first experience didn't reflect it due to Maroon Mobile, LLC. Don't be fooled when they tout a 30-day warranty. They said they would provide a full refund after I sent pictures, but then said the phone was damaged when they received it. Save your money, save your time, and save your frustration. AVOID Maroon Mobile, LLC.

Review.Titre: Double check your address
Review.Contenu: I updated the shipping address during the checkout and it reverted back to my billing address zip code. Swappa/PayPal did not have a process to confirm the shipping address (something virtually all ecommerce websites have in 2020). This caused the seller to cancel the sale, it took over a week to be refunded, and then when it was relisted someone else bought the item. It was my original fault, just felt like an easy thing a quick developer project would have fixed for a website this old.

Review.Titre: Great place for used phone but no buyer ratings.
Review.Contenu: Swappa is a great place to get a used phone at a great price and fairly fast turn around time! The lower rating is based on buyers do not get ratings or the rating system is broken. I've purchased multiple phones under my Xda linked profile rating and with the new system conversion, I lost all rating and am at 0, which makes my account look new and unreliable. If you buy a phone, complete the payment and transaction, the seller should be have to rate your speed of payment and/or communication. They skip that and you have nothing for others to see if you are a reliable payer. Swappa needs to fix these things.

Review.Titre: Swappa in general are okay
Review.Contenu: Swappa in general are okay, but I had an experience a couple of months ago which was frustrating. The seller was taking a long time to ship the product and I felt that swappa was not very helpful. I asked for specifics in writing as to how long the shipper had to send the product and they refused to provide it to me. Each rep seemed quite snippy and very supportive of the shipper who was taking a long time to send the product way past the suggested two day  guideline. So, if you want lots of attitude and snippyness, reach out to these guys and they will give you plenty.Follow up: Swappa responded with nice apology. I wonder who named me “Bitter Customer “? Lol

Review.Titre: I've had good experiences with Swappa…
Review.Contenu: I've had good experiences with Swappa before but in this case the transaction would not go through until the buyer changed his PayPal account from his business account to his personal account.  Swappa support was at the Mercy of PayPal's system glitch but did not seem to push for a resolution with PayPal aggressivey enough.  There should be another payment option

Review.Titre: Disappointed with the conflicting…
Review.Contenu: Disappointed with the conflicting information from Swappa staff. Seems like no uniform rules and lack of regulation. The staff did not resolve the issue, the ad on swappa was misleading and the staff did not do anything about it even after the seller acknowledge. As a buyer I felt like being cheated not getting what I paid for.The other transaction went fine.

Review.Titre: Swappa is good if there are no problems but they are useless if there's an issue.
Review.Contenu: The first Iphone I bought was not shipped by the seller. Swappa refers  you to Paypal to resolve the problem but provides no information or assistance. Paypal, as you may have experienced, makes it difficult to find a telephone number to open a dispute. Swappa was useless and provides no means for me to give a negative review of the seller because the transaction never completed. The second iphone was promptly shipped and is working well.

Review.Titre: They overcharge fees (both theirs and…
Review.Contenu: They overcharge fees (both theirs and PayPal, and refuse to allow an alternative) and don't take responsibility for their errors. The fee they charge is only for them to validate the pictures, which is important but should not cost 20$ + the PayPal fee on these 20$ (which they make you cover although they get these 20$... Very rude)

Review.Titre: Trustworthy & Great market(BUT).
Review.Contenu: Trustworthy & Great market(BUT).I love Swappa for all it is. But, their customer service is only one-sided - sellers. The buyers are almost neglected. They only consider the seller's point of view. ALWAYS BUY FROM A TRUSTED SELLER—communication of utmost importance. A few of new sellers, don't communicate after the sale - NO REPLIES. Swappa does not condemn this kind of behaviour from the seller. The staff don't care about the buyer's point of view; they don't respond to queries or comments.

Review.Titre: Swappa is one of the worst communities…
Review.Contenu: Swappa is one of the worst communities I've ever had the displeasure of using to sell electronics. They have a flawed system ripe with ways to be ripped off, awful one sided staff that does nothing but bark rules back at you when you ask them for any sort of assistance, and then they'll hound you unrelentlessly like you are some kind of criminal if you happen to have a customer who demands a refund for literally no reason. Websites trash and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Review.Titre: Sites support is lack luster
Review.Contenu: Sites support is lack luster, it’s essentially a Wild West. If there’s any issues your only hope is that your shipping company or PayPal will help you because the sites administration will do essentially nothing besides repeat their policies. Only redeeming quality is the ease of use when it comes to the site and buying and selling.

Review.Titre: Swappa is a fine service but not Paypal
Review.Contenu: Swappa is a fine service - but Paypal isn't.  I quit Paypal a long time ago due to their lack of security, high fees and other reasons.  Swappa should find other payment methods as a choice.I stand by my review.  You can't control Paypal however you CAN add other forms of payment!!

Review.Titre: so hard to get approval
Review.Contenu: It is pretty hard to get approval for what I post. And it always spend a lot of time. I enter the EIMI to your website and it shows I can list. But finally I always get feedback that my phones have financial problem by emails. Most of time, I am wasting my time on here.

Review.Titre: Not what it seems.
Review.Contenu: The signup was easy. The listing had gone well too. I sold my item, got paid, shipped it, I even got a good review from the purchaser. That is until a week later, when the purchaser is asking for a portion of their money back because they didn’t read the listing and they thought they had purchased a different item. The good news is they’re ‘ok’ with keeping the item but feel as though they ‘overpaid’ and would like a partial refund based on their misunderstanding. Total nonsense, I know their motto is no jerks but seriously how likely is it that I sell 1 item on their platform and find the one guy? I was hoping this could replace eBay for me, but I'm still looking.

Review.Titre: Inadequate sales policy for whole sellers
Review.Contenu: Swappa shouldn't allow any seller (in this case was wholeseller) to post images of real used devices that are not actual device being shipped to the buyer. They use it under "stock image" that should be representing "similar" condition. In my case it was far from it. So, to make a purchasing experience good, they need to make  these sellers describe in details damages in the text and only post a real photo of the shipped device or a generic digital picture of the device from the manufacturers gallery.That way nobody can be lead to believe they are looking at the item they are buying and will focus on the detailed text.

Review.Titre: Swappa shipping through the USPS was…
Review.Contenu: Swappa shipping through the USPS was horribly unreliable. It seems clear that Swappa negotiates low rates on shipping, and in exchange their packages get deprioritized by the USPS. Will strongly avoid Swappa in the future unless they choose a different shipping provider.

Review.Titre: Swappa shipping through the USPS was…
Review.Contenu: Swappa shipping through the USPS was horribly unreliable. It seems clear that Swappa negotiates low rates on shipping, and in exchange their packages get deprioritized by the USPS. Will strongly avoid Swappa in the future unless they choose a different shipping provider.

Review.Titre: Hidden partner fees, not using Swappa again
Review.Contenu: Slightly horseshit on Swappa's part. There is a $10 fee for listing on Swappa, but NOWHERE is it mentioned that you will also be on the hook with the PayPal Seller Fee, this was -$25ish on a recent sale, making it fawking $35 for the pleasure of selling a phone on Swappa. Lmfao, never again will I use this BS, just going directly to eBay/OfferUp/LetGo/FB Marketplace from now on and skipping Swappa entirely ever again. Funds are also still being held despite the phone being delivered. A for effort, F- for execution and deceptive fee structure.

Review.Titre: Be careful
Review.Contenu: Swappa itself is amazing, but the seller I bought the iphone through sold me a carrier locked phone to another carrier other then the stated T-Mobile on the listing. Swappa can we please have a better IMEI checker on your site so us customers are not sold carrier locked phones

Review.Titre: Pricing for sellers has gotten worse
Review.Contenu: Pricing for sellers has gotten worse! After the Swappa fees and the Paypal cut, it looks equally bad as eBay. They say 3% is being paid by buyers, but higher prices will not sell. Will stop using Swappa.

Review.Titre: I wanted a PS4 for my son’s Christmas…
Review.Contenu: I wanted a PS4 for my son’s Christmas but didn’t want a new one due to cost and not going to be used too much. I knew of Swappa so figured I’d give a look. I was pleasantly impressed with the selection and options of purchasing. I found the one we wanted, placed the order and was promptly informed by the seller it would be shipping asap. It was and we received it when expected and in excellent condition. I’ve now bought an Iphone and a PS4 on Swappa and both were excellent purchases as well as experiences. I’ll certainly be using this first for all my electronic needs. Thank you!

Review.Titre: The site is the worst I have ever used…
Review.Contenu: The site is the worst I have ever used to sell an item. The way offers come in is awful. It favors the buyer and opens the seller's counter-offers to the general public. Swappa should model it's site closer to ebay, which seems to work pretty well for both buyer and seller.

Review.Titre: At first was a fantastic phone
Review.Contenu: At first was a fantastic phone. Second day after receiving the phone it would die at 45%. Was not warned that device would need new battery. Also the charger piece that plugs into the wall had bent prongs so it was obviously a used cord. It has glitched a total of 4 times in the almost less than a week I’ve had it.

Review.Titre: My package was delievered and I didn’t…
Review.Contenu: My package was delievered and I didn’t get payment until much later. I included tracking information, and tracked the package using that same information. It’s nerve racking sending out a $500+ laptop and not having the money even after it’s been delivered.

Review.Titre: I don't feel I got the support I need…
Review.Contenu: I don't feel I got the support I need from Swappa when a Seller refused to reimburse me the shipping/insurance charges to return a phone that was blacklisted.I'm not sure what measures need to be implemented, but I am sorely disappointed with the reaction of Swappa.

Review.Titre: Swappa did nothing on this except take…
Review.Contenu: Swappa did nothing on this except take fees from the seller and provide the virtual meeting place. These stars are from the last 4 transactions where Swappa has lost their way from where they started from and refuse to hold people to a standard they profess to uphold. No junk and no jerks should be their internal motto not their elitist mirage of a standard they say they hold others to. To have people try and rip you off on their platform twice, and now get Swappa staff's canned anemic responses makes eBay and Craigslist look gloriously competent. Let's see if Trustpilot has integrity to post an honest review.

Review.Titre: Bad phone on Swappa. Bad replacement.  Bad Swappa.
Review.Contenu: I bought one phone through Swappa.  It was defective.  Their seller sent a replacement phone that was even more defective.  Happily, after I returned both phones the seller issued a refund.  But, what a waste of time and effort.  I ended up buying a brand new phone on Amazon for $40 more.  I realize this is just one seller, but it's also my only experience using Swappa.  This was a highly rated seller who apparently doesn't follow Swappa's own rules.  I wonder, is this commonplace on Swappa?  I'm not inclined to try it out again.

Review.Titre: Buy from well-rated Users only!
Review.Contenu: I have had good experiences selling devices, poor experiences buying devices.  Tried buying a Galaxy s8+ when it first came out and had to try purchasing from three different users on Swappa due to phone issues or fraud.  I will only purchase form users that have a high rating from now on.

Review.Titre: Private sale between the two of you...
Review.Contenu: I bought 3 items from swappa.com and everything went nicely. However there was a 4th item which I did not like as it was not as described. I initiated a return and got a refund from the seller. But before I got the refund, I had contacted swappa.com as I did not get it automatically - upon the seller receiving the item. What swappa.com said was eye opening to me as it indicated a lack of liability and negligence in overseeing the entirety of our sale. They said I would have to contact the seller as it was a private sale between the two of us. If I wanted little oversight then I would go to ebay or somewhere I could be swindled. I did NOT expect this from swappa. My expectations regarding the integrity of this site have halved. I will have to move much more cautiously than I have done in the past - for this website.

Review.Titre: In the past swappa was a fantastic…
Review.Contenu: In the past swappa was a fantastic experience but latley it seems like they have lost there touch, closing the boneyard, not following through on the "marketplace 2.0 half a**ed implementation and don't get me started on the app that has more bugs that my local garage dump.

Review.Titre: Its really frustrating feeling like the…
Review.Contenu: Its really frustrating feeling like the employees here patronanize you for getting frustrated about an item you that you have paid more than $3,000 for when the item is now 8 days past the expected delivery date. Very unprofessional to say the least.

Review.Titre: Staff is incompetent, may not be worth selling here anymore.
Review.Contenu: The website staff members get increasingly incompetent every time I am there. I have been selling for about 5 years and every single one of my transactions is rated 5 stars. However they take exception to the condition described as mint. So now they are policing descriptions and disagree if they don't think that the device looks meant.On the other hand commercial sellers are selling devices as "good condition" where they have scratches described in the condition.I seriously doubt saving $10 on the sale is worth this amount of trouble and paying for the shipping myself.

Review.Titre: Disappointed and inconvenience
Review.Contenu: I'm pretty upset that you guys cancelled my order and I have to wait days for my refund without even trying to contact me and see if my address was correct. It should have been a simple question but I was never given that courtesy. Even if we talked about it and you said it's not able to be corrected or pushed through I'd have been fine with that if you would have reached out and held a conversation with me instead of just assuming that the seller was correct. I've been living at the address for eight years it's the correct address Just kind of disappointed in the way was handled.

Review.Titre: Well
Review.Contenu: Well, with my final purchase of a Note 9 "mint" code SUCF43402. I left a comment when I received the device. I set comment I informed the seller that the stylus inside the mint note 9 was a fake. I clicked on notify staff but up to this date neither swappa nor the seller have replied to me. I had to buy a stylus myself because that was the only part of the phone that wasn't as advertised. I didn't notice this until after I had completed the sale. I thought it was a software bug so I started downloading all the updates. Seems like after you and the seller got your money you stopped caring.

Review.Titre: very disappointed
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately, The phone I bought was on the blacklist and no one at Swappa did the research before promoting the sale. I sent an email asking for help with this issue a week ago and I haven't heard anything back from the company!

Review.Titre: Stay away -- shipping
Review.Contenu: Stay away -- the shipping arrangements are ridiculously unsatisfactory if you are buying anything that you need.  I ordered a phone for $700 plus and conditioned the sale on it being shipped immediately.  The seller shipped on tme but deliberately chose the slowest possible shipping manner -- UPS ground, which is six days per UPS, which means "someday."  Swappa says "too bad, UPS ground is acceptable." Sure, he's being unhelpful but Swappa is no help either.   I've had previous transactions that were acceptable.  I recommend staying away from this poor service.  Amazon prime shipping is reliably quick.

Review.Titre: All combined Fees and Shipping does not make sense.
Review.Contenu: All combined Fees and Shipping does not make sense, plus now Sales Tax is collected for the Buyer. By the time I paid the fees and shipping I lost money on a Pixel 4a that I should of made some $$$ on. Wont be selling again on here.

Review.Titre: Responsibility
Review.Contenu: I bought a phone and the gentleman put an inaccurate description. He said the storage was 128 gb when it was only 64 gb. It also had an extremely loose charge port where the cable would just fall out or disconnect from transferring data or charging very easily, this was not mentioned. He agreed to a refund but I had to pay to send it back. If I would have bought from somewhere else like eBay the seller who made the inaccurate description would have had to pay for this, now I don't have a phone and it cost me $20 to ship back because somebody else lied to me to sell their phone easier and for more money. Probably won't use this service again.

Review.Titre: I bought a S9 from Maroon Mobile
Review.Contenu: I bought a S9 from Maroon Mobile, LLC.   It makes calls, but the receiver cannot hear me on the other end and the phone seems to lag a little.I thought everything was tested?  On my way out of town with hopefully the old phone service restored.

Review.Titre: Not What It Once Was
Review.Contenu: As a platform, Swappa is fine.  I've been using it since it came into existence.  When things are good, which is probably most of the time, then there are no problems and nothing to worry about.The problems come into play when things don't initially go as expected.  Have an issue with a seller that made a mistake or two?  Well, if that seller is a business seller that helps Swappa collect a lot in fees... don't expect Swappa to take your side or provide good service.  From a Customer Service / Customer Support standpoint, Swappa has fallen very far from the early days.  It is extremely unfortunate.

Review.Titre: Swappa customer support is poor
Review.Contenu: Swappa customer support is poor. About a month ago seller had a problem in receiving my payment that was done. Swappa didn’t help me so the Apple TV was sold to someone else after multiple attempts of resolving the issue from my part.

Review.Titre: Buyer Beware!!!
Review.Contenu: Saw all the positive reviews and read about Swappa where they say "real humans approve all items for sale before they show up for sale on the site and we fight fraud so you don't have to." Well I bought a new iphone 11 and paid immediately with PayPal and received a message 2 hours later from Swappa saying the seller was up to no good and banned from their site and I should open a dispute claim with PayPal. Bottom line i will get my money back but it will take up to 45 days in which time I don't have the money and can't get a new phone until then which really sucks. I hope other people have way better luck than I did....

Review.Titre: No Resolution for a faulty sale
Review.Contenu: I purchased a phone, it was listed as unlocked. It would not connect to the Verizon network and after multiple hours dealing with both Verizon and Google (it was a Pixel) it would not work. The phone was in great condition however as the first Swappa rep that commented on our conversation stated if the phone wouldn't connect to the network then there should be a refund made. The seller refused to do a refund and a second Swappa rep came on the conversation and then stated it was a dispute between the buyer and seller and we needed to come to a solution. I went to Best Buy and was given a solution there in the form of trading in the phone for a new phone. This was my first time using Swappa and most definitely my last.

Review.Titre: High fees from all sides
Review.Contenu: High fees from all sides - Swappa, PayPal and then shipping. I could have recycled my phone for the same amount and less hassle. And then...the PayPal hold on my money. Don’t even get me started on that.

Review.Titre: Swappa staff were very discourteous and…
Review.Contenu: Swappa staff were very discourteous and spoke to me as though I was mentally deficient. Seller was willing to meet me to exchange the phone, yet the staff felt they needed to remind me numerous times that Paypal protections would not be available if we did a local sale. After I asked whether or not they worked for Paypal Jon L. told me that I was on my own after his last message. The phone works fine. Go to eBay to get a phone from now on.In reply to the response:So was Jon L. correct in that your service ends as soon as the consumer and seller decide to do a local sale? If that's the case, what's the benefit to using your service as opposed to eBay?

Review.Titre: Good, but not Great
Review.Contenu: Swappa offers a great, easy to use site. My only gripe is that they only allow PayPal transactions. There are many other payment options available. Swappa needs to expand and allow for more choice.

Review.Titre: I bought an I watch for my boyfriend…
Review.Contenu: I bought an I watch for my boyfriend for our anniversary, since the beginning it took longer than expected. It supposed to be mint and had a lot of marks and look good at best. We returned the next working day that was a Monday, the seller got it in his hand by Wednesday and by mistake my boyfriend forgot to take it out of his iCloud, the seller told us and we solve it right away but he keep telling that it wasn’t ok, we sent photos of the scratch, the devices at our iCloud, everything, but the seller stop to respond and we ask Swappa for a solution and a refund. They did nothing and ask us to do it through PayPal. Now we don’t even know if we going to get a refund at all and the las response of the seller was I’m going out of the country and I will not have internet. Where is he going, Everest? So the purchase is not really protected by swappa but for PayPal and they just wash their hands! So is like any other web page, is not safer than Facebook market or eBay, same thing.Is a matter of luck, if you have an honest seller will be a good experience, if not you will get robbed.

Review.Titre: Disappointing first Experience
Review.Contenu: I tried purchasing a device for the first time and as much as the process was easy to complete, my package was not sent and the seller refuses to give me back my hundreds of dollars I paid. Highly dissatisfied

Review.Titre: Communication between seller and buyer…
Review.Contenu: Communication between seller and buyer is delayed and poorly done. You have to sit on the site if you make an offer to watch for a reply. Otherwise, your offer becomes everyone's offer.

Review.Titre: Customer service protocols for dispute very confusing
Review.Contenu: The seller of my item was unresponsive, so I reached out to Swappa to help resolve. After there was still no response from the seller (I had already paid via paypal), Swappa told me I'd have to use the dispute process in PayPal. So, I went out to PayPal, and as part of the dispute process in PayPay it encourages you to reach out to the payee directly before disputing, which I did. It was at this point at which the seller did get back to me and apologized profusely for the delay (he had some personal reasons for being offline), and promptly got the item to me. When I updated Swappa about this, I let them know they could put the sale back up so I could rate, but then they scolded me for contacting the buyer directly, even though that's the PayPal policy. They need to iron out their protocols for this kind of situation, because it was a mess and not at all easy for me to resolve the issue.

Review.Titre: Seller's Ask Price or List Fee?
Review.Contenu: I thought I was purchasing a phone listed for 485.00$, but was charged a 15.00 Swappa fee. Plus tax.  When I contacted Swappa, the customer service agent said The 485.00 is the seller's ask price, not the list fee. So, I am paying 500, which included the Swappa fee.  As a buyer, I think it's misleading and shady, to list products in this way.  When I contacted customer service and sent screen shots of my receipt that did not include the breakdown of the swappa fee and seller's ask price, but did show the 485.00 number, he was condescending and rude to me. He was unable to clarify anything and eventually sent me to another person when I asked for a manager.  The entire experience left a bad taste in my mouth and I am not going to use Swappa again because of it.

Review.Titre: The service has changed recently
Review.Contenu: I have used Swappa since 2019. My experience prior to 2023 has been great. At the beginning of this year, I tried buying an iPhone 14. The first purchase I made was still tied to a carrier. When I tried to activate it on Verizon, they wouldn't let me because the phone still had payments due. Swappa checks the IMEI, but doesn't check if the phone is still being paid off. Reaching out to Swappa's support just points you to get your refund through PayPal.For the second purchase I made, the seller listed "Mint" condition but sent a phone with a bunch of scratches on the screen. Again, support only points you to PayPal.I was able to get refunds for both of my purchases (eventually) through PayPal, but both of these issues could have been prevented by Swappa.Also, I was the one paying for return shipping and never got reimbursed.I sent an email to Swappa's support and never heard anything.

Review.Titre: Non Genuine Apple Part
Review.Contenu: The purchasing aspect was smooth and simple. Swaps should be commended for that. However, I think the individuals/companies that are selling the phones are sometimes dishonest/not transparent about the quality of the phone being sold. While the iPhone that I ordered looked to be in good shape, it turns out that it has a non genuine apple screen that is glitchy. Now I’m stuck with a messed up phone or I have to pay $200 more For apple to repair the screen. I could have bout a brand new iPhone instead.

Review.Titre: The independent seller made the sale
Review.Contenu: The independent seller made the sale.  Swappa had become this horrible place of wholesale sellers and massive fees.  Swappa still had to add on all their fees in the end (which is exactly why the started in the first place - ironic).  But the independent seller made the sale.  I don't buy from wholesalers anymore on Swappa because Swappa allows them to get around the rules (photos of device, listing phones of poor quality as good, no response from sellers on questions about the phones).  They are hard to find, but if you use Swappa, use the independent sellers.  They want to earn your positive feedback and give you an accurate device and great purchasing experience.  Unfortunately Swappa has become the antithesis of their roots bending to the whims of wholesalers and being greedy on fees.

Review.Titre: The phone sold quickly and the process…
Review.Contenu: The phone sold quickly and the process was secure. All of the fees, especially the PayPal fee, is ridiculously high. They should offer other methods of payment.

Review.Titre: Swappa is great except for ...
Review.Contenu: I've been buying and selling on Swappa for several years. Great and safe platform to buy/sell, although I've never had a bad experience that I've needed to involve Swappa to resolve. The one negative I have is that the platform has been pretty much taken over by commercial sellers with it going from a platform for average people to buy and sell on to a highly commercialized platform for industry resellers. Also, Swappa does not provide a way to filter out the listings from private parties and the commercial sellers.

Review.Titre: My account was deactivated after two…
Review.Contenu: My account was deactivated after two orders just because I asked for my the limit placed on my account lifted. and upon getting swappa's response, the accounts belongs to different persons, the address belongs to a drop off who in turn send out purchased items to respective owners.

Review.Titre: No Junk, No Jerks...YMMV
Review.Contenu: Swappa likes to say "no junk, no jerks", but that's not entirely accurate. I'm sure that most of the transactions on the site go perfectly, but I have only had about 50% success when it comes to avoiding jerks. That's probably the same on any peer-to-peer sales site, to be honest, but I just want to point out that there is nothing exceptional about Swappa.

Review.Titre: Stuck with a 3+ week shipping delay
Review.Contenu: USPS completely botched the shipment, they didn't lose the package but it took them 3+ weeks to deliver it. During this time Swappa didn't allow me to cancel, I was forced to wait however long USPS might take. I had an international trip coming up and it barely made it before my departure. This is an unusual risk when buying from Swappa, compared to a big retailer that permits refusing shipment electronically, rerouting the package back to shipper etc. So even though Swappa wasn't at fault, they haven't addressed the scenarios when their shipping partners mess up. This results in the buyer being powerless, waiting for weeks, instead of cancelling and ordering from elsewhere. Next time I need a device, I will think twice before engaging with these risks.

Review.Titre: Listed my Mint condition iPhone 13 Pro…
Review.Contenu: Listed my Mint condition iPhone 13 Pro Max 1TB and the very good news was it sold very quickly. I’m brand new to swappa and this was my first sale. Three stars only for the HUGE amount of hidden fees that were not made crystal clear upfront. I thought the $21 or so fee was going to be what was deducted. However $67 taxes, $110 for another fee (don’t know still), $21 for my portion of the swappa fees, and another fee or two all reduced my sale price by 1/3rd. I don’t think I’ll ever use swappa again. This price/fee structure needs to be UPFRONT/CRYSTAL CLEAR/EXAMPLES GIVEN, etc. Happy with buyer experience but the rest of it left a really bad taste in my mouth.

Review.Titre: Not bad, but the comments system could use work.
Review.Contenu: The only problem is that all comments are public.  Its a little disconcerting to be negotiating price with a customer and all others can read the conversation.  Also, The app doesn't update in IOS immediately or automatically.  So when you send a comment, you are sure if the comment you just wrote has posted and you will end up sending the same comment more than once just to be sure.

Review.Titre: Nice site for finding just what I…
Review.Contenu: Nice site for finding just what I wanted.  But it was not obvious how to navigate the payment and shipping part of the transaction.  When there were problems, Swappa was right there to help.  I'd rate their support as excellent.

Review.Titre: Swappa works fine.  Until it doesn't.
Review.Contenu: I use Swappa all the time.  Usually it goes off without a hitch.  But about a month ago I had a transaction where the Seller never sent the item.  I tried to reach out to Swappa about resolving the issue, but their response was effectively to file a claim with PayPal.  I've done that, and am still waiting on my money to be returned.  We're going on six weeks now.  In this instance, I don't think they have added much value to the transaction.

Review.Titre: Bought Iphone 11pro Max and was able to…
Review.Contenu: Bought Iphone 11pro Max and was able to use it with Tmobile. However, I was not able to set up eSim while abroad because of carrier sim lock. Tm said the phone was originally sold by Sprint and it wasn't fully paid. Tm was able to set up the phone because Tm took over Sprint but won't be able to unlock the sim for other carriers.

Review.Titre: Good if you can find an individual seller
Review.Contenu: Swappa is good if you are able to find an individual seller. But unfortunately, it has been taken over mostly by large companies. The whole reason we used to use Swappa was that we could deal with individuals just selling their old phones and computers. But you are hard pressed to find it anymore. We were fortunate enough to find someone this time around.

Review.Titre: Inaccurate description regarding payments that's used to promote website.
Review.Contenu: Website advertises get paid immediately but this is not accurate. It depends on what PayPal wants to do. Made a sale where the money was withhold until buyer receives then buyer has to approve that they received for money to clear. Or you have to haggle with Paypal for them to go based off tracking number showing delivered. Then I made a purchase where it took a week to receive from seller however the money was paid to them immediately after sending payment.

Review.Titre: Spam emails are out of control
Review.Contenu: I do NOT enjoy the amount of spam from Swappa before and after a purchase. I received 3 emails in just over half a day before purchase, reminding me that I put an item in my cart. Then got 9 emails in a day post-purchase. Useful ones:1. purchase confirmation2. seller telling me when they'd ship the product3. tracking infoThe rest was telling me to write this review, write a review on another site, download their app, and multiple "thank you" ads for the company I just spent money with. That's an email every 3 hours, 66% of which have essentially no relevance to my purchase. Why?*Response to Swappa Rep:What a patronizing response to my question, that passively assumes I was "overwhelmed" by Swappa's spamming of useless emails.Saying "some emails" are for marketing even though the vast majority are marketing-based, as I've pointed out, is disingenuous.I won't be doing business with this company despite my previous good experiences as a result of this nonsense.

Review.Titre: Tell you what I really dislike about…
Review.Contenu: Tell you what I really dislike about your company: if you're going to give every potential buyer the bull... message that their credit cards "cannot be verified at this time" and they're forced to use only PayPal for their purchases, at least tell us that up front. Personally, I hate PayPal and never wanted you use them. But I wanted the phone so I bit the bullet. Please improve on your PayPal only policy. Otherwise, I was happy with the service. Your online responses came quickly which I appreciated.

Review.Titre: Swappa is good, but you are on your own if there is a dispute.
Review.Contenu: [Update]: After getting paypal involved, the seller did finally ship the device. He had listed it as Mint, but what I received would better be classified as Fair (Well used with lots of scratches, but it does function as needed). [/Update]Overall, I love swappa, but not happy with this buying experience. New seller and he never shipped the item. Swappa basically just boots the guy off the platform and then leaves me to deal with Paypal for getting my money back. While I appreciate them removing this seller, I thought there would be more assistance in resolving the issue.

Review.Titre: Fees more than expected
Review.Contenu: The good is that my iPhone 11 Pro Max sold in 1 day. The not good is the lack of fee clarity. Based on the "Seller Payout" total fees should have been 11.6% of the total price but further fees are added after the sale so actual fees are 16.7% reducing the payout expected. After also paying shipping it was not much better than just selling back to Apple.Reply to Swappa's response: the ask price and fees were as indicated including in a "Seller Payout" of $460.75, however the actual amount received was $439.26 so was not expecting further unstated fees.

Review.Titre: Great site but too many low quality sellers from stores
Review.Contenu: I have bought and sold phones on here. I find it a great site overall. I go here to look for the direct sellers rather than the store sellers. Everywhere I go are the store sellers. Lately I have seen Swappa allowed store sellers post the same picture and codes for multiple phones. The picture of the code is supposed to match the phone listing. In all cases where I have looked, it’s the same generic picture of the code. Shameful that they approved them. I avoided all of those listings and looked for the ones from real people selling their phone.

Review.Titre: Swappa is difficult now.
Review.Contenu: It’s become difficult to buy and sell items on swappa. It’s possible to find good deals, but it is overrun with businesses that sell phones in volume. The fees are still lower than eBay, but the personal interaction between individual sellers that the site had is gone at this point.

Review.Titre: The phone was specced properly, but not inspected properly.
Review.Contenu: Phone specs for everything I asked for, from the model number to the memory size.  Phone condition however left a bit to be desired, unlike the display picture, and not even in the quality category that it was claimed to be in.  Sale complete, I'm moving on.

Review.Titre: swappa is good…
Review.Contenu: swappa is a very good platform I loved buying a recommendation I am an impulsive buyer I like to see offers I would like more people to show up who sell their products to be able to take advantage of their offers of the rest. perfect

Review.Titre: Good, but...
Review.Contenu: The platform is great and i feel secure on buying devices up to a point. Outlet sellers should be looked at, the fact that the pictures of devices don't have to be the ones pictured and make me hesitate when buying.

Review.Titre: Getting the buyer to close the sale was…
Review.Contenu: Getting the buyer to close the sale was a hassle. I did not have access to the funds due to the buyer not marking the sale complete thru PayPal. Asked numerous times for Swappa staff to assist but would never get any replies.

Review.Titre: Last Purchase Of IPhone XS 256 IPhone…
Review.Contenu: Last Purchase Of IPhone XS 256 IPhone Was Not Good At All ! The Seller Listed This Phone As “MINT” Condition It Took Me 20 Minutes Of Cleaning With Alcohol And Cotton Balls To Just Clean It Up ! It Was Disgustingly NASTY !
