It Even Had Greasy Grimey Fingerprints Underneath The Screen Protector ! Everyone With Common Sense Cleans The Screen Before Putting On A New Screen Protector ! Also They Sent It In A DISGUSTINGLY NASTY Wore Out Phone Case That Was NASTY ! We Bought An IPhone XS 64gb Listed As GOOD Condition And It Looked BRAND New Compared To The So Called MINT 256 Gb IPhone XS ! I Have Decided To Just Buy Refurbished On EBay Their Phones Are ALWAYS CLEAN Like New As LISTED !

Review.Titre: Lack of instructions and guidance for…
Review.Contenu: Lack of instructions and guidance for first time listing. While making the listing it kept taking me to a web site and out of the app for some reason? But got it figured out.Was also not at all expecting to pay PayPal that much for absolutely doing nothing wth is up with that? You’re not any cheeper than eBay so meh. Will see but eBay is easier and easier to figure out what to charge at the end of the day to be honest. and you don’t have to ever  deal with Paypal so that a big plus.

Review.Titre: Not a smooth process.  Short story..I purchased a "NEW"…
Review.Contenu: Short story..I purchased a "NEW" carrier verizon phone. The phone arrived in sealed box. I opened the box and from directions from my local verizon switched the sim card to new phone, it wouldn't recongnize the sim. After a visit to my local verizon we couldn't get the 3 sim's we tried to work, manager stated it must be a bad phone. I decided to return to seller for a refund, with very little directions from swappa. I insured the return package, which never arrived (per Seller) USPS said they have GPS of delivery. Now I'm waiting the minumim time limit to file an insurance claim. Very little directions or suggestion from swappa. lessons learned insurance for $500 no signature required but insurance for $501 signature required. I started an insurance claim on 5/07/2023, as of today 05/15/2023 it's still under review by USPS

Review.Titre: I have been using Swappa for years
Review.Contenu: I have been using Swappa for years, bought 7-10 devices.... Most recently purchased a product. After contacting Swappa staff, they suspected it a Scam listing and instructed me to seek refund from paypal.... Using Paypal, you do not receive your money back for another 2-3 weeks. Given the wait time on Swappa side, you are without your money for 3-4 weeks... Was not too bad with my 200$ purchase.... But I cannot imagine this wait time on a 600-1000$ purchase.... Completely unacceptable refund process for these high dollar items.However, when a purchase goes smoothly, it goes smoothly. If you are ever in the situation of needing a refund, the process is slow.

Review.Titre: Lots of low quality products there
Review.Contenu: Lots of low quality products there.However, sellers are required to provide all the information about the device and you can get a refund if the device is not as advertised.In my case, the iphone 12 had a bad speaker and I got a full refund including return shipping.  Had I accepted the device and not realized the speaker was bad, I would have been out of hundreds of dollars.Many phones have replaced screens, which is something you may miss if you don't read the listing carefully. Sellers are motivated to work with you, but you need to be really careful in how you check the device.  You miss something and you're on the hook.

Review.Titre: Using Swappa is seamless and super…
Review.Contenu: Swappa provides a seamless and incredibly convenient platform for buying and selling. However, there are a few aspects that could be improved. One notable concern is the fees charged by Swappa, along with the additional fees imposed by PayPal. This double fee structure can be frustrating for users. Moreover, when a transaction involves foreign currency, sellers often incur losses, which seems unfair. Despite these shortcomings, Swappa remains a highly user-friendly platform that streamlines the buying and selling process. It would be great if the fees could be reevaluated to ensure a fairer and more transparent pricing structure. Additionally, addressing the issue of currency conversion and its impact on seller profits would greatly enhance the overall experience for international transactions.

Review.Titre: The experience of selling on Swappa is…
Review.Contenu: The experience of selling on Swappa is easy and their customer service is great; however, their fees have exploded. I remember when it was $5-$10 to sell on their platform and they try and make it out like the buyer pays a fee, but it’s really the seller as they have to be conscious of how high they price their item. Might as well call them EBay lite at this point and with a smaller audience to sell to. Probably will be the last time I sell on them.

Review.Titre: Swappa sellers are hit or miss
Review.Contenu: Swappa sellers are hit or miss. After two bad experiences (in one of which I received a stolen phone that could not be activated and it took over a month to receive a refund), I decided to try one more time. That third time I luckily bought from a professional seller who sold me a brand new, not stolen, phone and shipped promptly. It may not be worth the hassle for some, but you can save some money. Warning: I was not able to leave a review for the seller who sold me the stolen phone and delayed a month in refunding my money. Buyers can only review completed sales. That means the reviews are artificially inflated.

Review.Titre: Had an issue with my purchase
Review.Contenu: Had an issue with my purchase - Swappa basically just shrugged and said "Take it up with PayPal". Would have been nice to have more support.

Review.Titre: when seller is great swappa is a great…
Review.Contenu: when seller is great swappa is a great platform. When the seller is not sending the item, swappa passes the issue on to PayPal and PayPal to the Credit card to be resolved in about 3 months.Update ... Swappa is very responsive as reply shows. Prior purchases have been fine. It is frustrating to have to deal with a long term credit card charge until resolved.

Review.Titre: Neutral - not good, not bad
Review.Contenu: Experience on swappa is alright, nothing great. There seems to be little done to validate the ad or the buyer, i.e. there is very little protection for the seller in case the buyer raises objections. The fees for this level of service is too high. There is also no option to review the buyer.

Review.Titre: got early but a demo phone saying ot for sale and no rigntone  access
Review.Contenu: I got he phonr on tiem actually early. it started up bu ti noticed the back said' not for sale used for only'. After that i overlooked it as the phone started to boot but then realized it didnt have a ringtone section. SO the tone on it is the only tone it has. the only one able to even use even after trying zedge . So i feel i ddeserve a refund or swap to upgrade . Ive agreed at dif for s21 pls and send this back but this phone stricty say demo not for peronal use then i dont have ringtones. I fel i deserve that . Im agreein to pay the diff for dif hpone eventhough it was not my mistake seelign a phone tha strictly states demo not or sale and has missing features

Review.Titre: Beware of carrier locked phones
Review.Contenu: Buying a carrier locked phone can be a nightmare if you’re not careful. For example, I bought a T-Mobile phone whose IMEI indicated that it was able to be used on MVNOs like ting and mint mobile. Upon receiving the phone, I was not able to activate the phone on anything but T-Mobile despite being given the green light by these other services.It would have saved me 3 days of headaches if Swappa made it even clearer which networks would work with the phone, and possibly which providers would not work with it. I also received subpar support through the buyer’s page. I had to reach out to email to get my issue resolved.In all, I would advise only buying unlocked phones from Swappa to avoid any hassles. I was not able to use my preferred cell provider (ting) nor return the phone. Looking up IMEI numbers for compatibility was not reliable in my case and Swappa will not side with you if things go wrong. The lesson for me was: Be careful and only buy completely unlocked phones. I’m uncertain if I’ll use Swappa again.

Review.Titre: The payment gateway though paypal do…
Review.Contenu: The payment gateway though paypal do not fuly workon Vivaldi Web browser, during the payment I has to change into Firefox.In overall, my first experience was nice and healthy, thank you.

Review.Titre: The prices charged are much higher than…
Review.Contenu: The prices charged are much higher than eBay once Swappa gets it's cut then Paypal takes theirs. It's very misleading when Swappa shows the total sale if an item not including PayPals cut.

Review.Titre: Buyer Beware!
Review.Contenu: When making a purchase of literally hundreds of dollars, Swappa should make 100% certain that the item listed is fully cleared/deleted, unlocked, and ready for the buyer to receive the product and begin using it. My seller sold me a phone that was none of the above. And took TEN DAYS of ME contacting and coaxing the very uncommunicative seller to pleeeeease take the time to clear, delete, and unluck the device. TEN DAYS! He wasn't responding to email or in-app Swappa chats, so I had to Google the person, find their place of employment, and text them there. C'mon people! Swappa's only recommendation when contacted was "well you can file a case with PayPal". Really? Swappa literally washed their hands of it right when I needed them most. So my recommendation to BUYERS is do not buy a phone unless the seller shows clear proof the device is wiped and ready to activate by the new owner. My recommendation to Swappa is to require PROOF that the device is wiped and ready, in addition to providing pictures with their listing showing proof. For the $150 I saved, I coulda just gone direct to the AT&T store and bought the phone there with WAY less trouble and toil.

Review.Titre: The overall services is great but as a…
Review.Contenu: The overall services is great but as a seller the fees is quite steep 10% of the sale is gone towards commissions both by PayPal and Swappa.

Review.Titre: It's easy to use, but expensive
Review.Contenu: It's easy to use, and you know what to expect. My only issue with swappa.com is the incredible fees that are charged to the seller.   The buyer doesn't see that side.  Here's the breakdown, directly from Paypal of this transaction.Purchase Total 669.50Sales Tax           57.74Gross Amount  727.24Paypal Fee       -25.87Partner Comm  -96.74Net amount      604.63Yes, I left out the lines Shipping, Handling, and Insurance, since they are all 0.00Either something is broken at Swappa, or at Paypal, or I'm getting the shaft!   I have the screenshot of this as well.  However, I can't add a picture here.

Review.Titre: Used to be affordable to sell, but not any more
Review.Contenu: I sold an Item in 2020 for $370; the total fees were $15.  I sold an item today for $360, and the fees + tax is $38.49.  Both do not include PayPal fees or shipping.  Swappa is no longer cheap for sellers, and it's comparable to eBay.  I will start selling things on the Facebook marketplace,  Craigslist moving forward.

Review.Titre: Website works great
Review.Contenu: Website works great. I will consider using again. However paypal sucks. You should drop them or find a better way to accept payment.

Review.Titre: Decent, battery not 100, no full charger
Review.Contenu: The phone is decent. However, mint condition phone didn’t mean 100% battery life, only 86%. I also didn’t receive a full phone charger, just usb to iPhone.

Review.Titre: I liked it better when Swappa was…
Review.Contenu: I liked it better when Swappa was private sellers only. Swappa is now full of commercial sellers.Letting electronic stores use stock photos feels deceiving.

Review.Titre: Seems like a very good market place
Review.Contenu: Seems like a very good market place, but competitive sites may make it more difficult to sell your phone...seemed to sell much quicker a year ago or so...

Review.Titre: I didn't get my item and lost my money
Review.Contenu: I didn't get my item and lost my money Apple AirPods Max - Gray	Apple AirPods Max - GrayStatus	CanceledListing	LXFA15390Condition	Used$264.71	$0	$21.51	1	$286.22

Review.Titre: Enormous Swappa transaction fees
Review.Contenu: Swappa is charging even more for their transaction fee. I'm going to find it very hard to use them in the future. $83 on a $590 sell. Ridiculous.

Review.Titre: Fees getting a little out of control
Review.Contenu: I like swappa and have used it for years.  The fees to utilize the site have gotten a little out of hand.  I just sold an item for 400.  Including the added fees, the buyer paid $440.82.  After my fees, my net profit from the sale was $372.

Review.Titre: Why So Much In Fees?!!!
Review.Contenu: The fees really will prevent me from selling on Swappa again...  Swappa charges a seller fee, a buyer fee then I got hit with a PayPal fee!  Lost almost 100 bucks off my sale :(

Review.Titre: Swappa can do better...
Review.Contenu: I purchased an iPad mini, and it was iCloud locked. The seller had wiped it, but forgot to remove the user lock. We made contact through Swappa, and expressed interest in communicating directly. Doing so was met with deleting of comments containing contact information, preventing us from doing so, and prolonging the problem. The seller somehow managed to sneak a peek and called me. Problem solved in no time. I was met with a suggestion to not use Swappa if I had a problem with their policies. My problem was NOT with their policies. My problem the seller and I BOTH expressed willingness to forego moderation and risk direct contact, and one of the three (?) moderators decided to delete that information. That should have CEASED the moment we asked to communicate directly. And the passive-aggressive response telling me to shop elsewhere was probably not the right answer to deescalate and resolve the concern. Leaving neutral feedback because despite the individual moderators, Swappa is still my most trusted forum to purchase electronics, so I couldn't bring myself to remain negative.

Review.Titre: Paypal holds
Review.Contenu: It would have been nice to know that paypal will not give me my funds when I sell.

Review.Titre: Swappa wipes their hands clean once the item sells.
Review.Contenu: Used UPS to ship the Apple Watch to the buyer, but UPS lost the item. UPS gave the run around, Swappa wasn't helpful and just kept saying to contact UPS. Finally UPS opened a case and paid the claim, but this took almost 3 months.

Review.Titre: Be really sure on your carrier
Review.Contenu: I use Mint Mobile. I thought I could buy a T-Mobile phone. Did not work. My lesson learned.

Review.Titre: Nice eBay alternative, BUT!
Review.Contenu: Nice alternative to eBay, BUT…Website states buyer and seller pays 3% fee. That’s not exactly correct. It does become more clear once you actually list an item if you pay very close attention to the numbers and do some math. Here is how it actually works out: You list something for $100. The buyer will pay 100 plus their local tax. The seller however will get about $94.09 from swappa, almost 6% less than the list /sold price. Through some really odd fuzzy math, they drop the list/sold price by 3% and then have the buyer pay the actual list price. It makes it seem on paper they are getting 3% from the buyer. But all they did is take 3% off and then add it back. For the seller, they take that lower number with the 3%  taken off (97.00) and then take 3% off that number (94.09) That’s what the seller gets. Essentially the buyer pays the list price and the seller gets almost 6% less than the list price. I’m fine with this, it’s still slightly less of a hit than ebay. What is really confusing is that they state in many places that the buyer and seller each pay 3%. Using my example of 100. Buyer pays 100. Seller gets about 94.09 before PayPal fees. Why not just say “we charge the seller 6%” ? That’s what is really happening.

Review.Titre: Needs Work!
Review.Contenu: I’m always looking to give my business to smaller entities when selling Apple products. Larger companies like eBay take too much in fees, are generally a nightmare to deal with and are full of scammers. Swappa is a great alternative but the people approving the listings can be very militant bordering on harassment. My experience is they are ALWAYS right and you are ALWAYS wrong...even when you are obviously right with documented proof to back it up. You’re good once you get the listing approved but be prepared to go through a rigorous, unnecessary process. The people approving the listings are not on your side and they are not customer service oriented in the least.

Review.Titre: It was easy but costly
Review.Contenu: It was easy, but because of the fees charged to the seller, raises the amount of the phone. Both user and seller seemed to be ripped off.

Review.Titre: I will buy from Swappa again…
Review.Contenu: Prices are good website wasn't easy to navigate phone wasn't charged and it took a little over a week to get it but I did choose standard mailing all in all a good experience

Review.Titre: The app crashes and is too slow loading
Review.Contenu: The app crashes! Every time kicks me out and i have to login every single time!The app is aslo slow , especialy when i go to (my swappa) tab or when i am in the (subscribed) section! It takes ages to open a listing! Around 10 seconds just to load a listing!!!Another problem is the (filter listings) and the arrangement of the listing! It's not continuously sorted from Price Lowest to Highest!I hope you fix this problems.

Review.Titre: Old Swappa was better.
Review.Contenu: Old Swappa was better.Swappa literally only provides a place to post. Seller and buyer protection are offered from Paypal. Although the posting IMEI and code check is done by a person, taking a pretty good percentage of sales is a bit much, especially since it used to be a flat fee. The whole reason why I don't sell on eBay is due to them taking percentage of sale, but eBay offers pretty good seller and buyer protection themselves.

Review.Titre: IPhone 12 Mini Purchase
Review.Contenu: iPhone and accessories exactly as described. Seller made the shipping more difficult then it needed to be. Instead of purchasing insurance they choose to make it signature required. This made it more difficult then it needed to be to receive.

Review.Titre: It was fine
Review.Contenu: It was fine. Purchase went through ok. Nothing great. Nothing bad.

Review.Titre: Good design, but be careful to ask about battery life and buy from a private seller
Review.Contenu: I like how Swappa has a good user interface and checks all phone IMEIs before they are allowed to be sold. It is easy to find all the models of phones for sale. What I don't like is that there are a lot of business sellers, who I heard just push out 100's of phones without really checking them. If you check their reviews, they may have 1000's of good reviews but 100 bad reviews. So it's better to buy from private sellers with a few good reviews. But it was hard to find much private sellers for some phone models.I don't like how business sellers are allowed to post placeholder images for their listings, so they can sell a bunch of phones but post a generic image. (there is a disclaimer though)Also Swappa doesn't include battery life in the condition requirements, so you can buy a good condition phone except the battery isn't as good. That's what happened to me, so it's not like I can claim Paypal protection. I should've asked about the battery condition before buying, I guess. Still the seller was very good otherwise so I didn't want to trouble with returning the phone. (a private seller)

Review.Titre: I think the site is a great site for…
Review.Contenu: I think the site is a great site for most transactions. However, I feel the refund policy is too restrictive. We as Buyers should be able to return devices for a refund if our customers mistakenly orderd the wrong product through us (Buyers). To be denied a return the same day the device arrives to me (and I'm talking about 1 every other year) is a poor experience. Please look to change this partticular part of your business.

Review.Titre: Great, except for the $18 UPS surcharge--beware!
Review.Contenu: Everything worked well, and I got a much higher price for my phone than through one of those places that buys it and resells it. The problem was that there was a verification issue with the address, and UPS charged me an additional $18. In my view, Swappa needs to do a better job of informing sellers of that risk and provide information about address verification. I won't use UPS again to ship the phone, at any rate. Apparently there is some fine print that lets them charge you $18 if the slightest thing goes wrong with the delivery--and I read that this is a big cash cow for them. That more than doubled the original shipping cost.

Review.Titre: Seller was a little misleading
Review.Contenu: Seller was a little misleading. Process was okay though. Should maybe send more emails or text updates?

Review.Titre: Swappa is a great, but has some issues…
Review.Contenu: Swappa is a great place for no nonsense selling. Recently, though, I have run into a few frustrations. First, their fees are more complicated now and by charging taxes cause buyers to not pay a premium for devices for sell. And not having reviews for buyers is not good. Not having the ability to rate a buyer causes some unwanted issues since many break the rules or do things that are not ethical.

Review.Titre: You actually did nothing
Review.Contenu: You actually did nothing. In the past, you notified me by email with tracking info. This time, nothing. It caused me to send out emails to complain, when in fact the item was on its way. Causing unnecessary issues with the seller/buyer.

Review.Titre: QUESTIONABLE INTEGRITY ??
Review.Contenu: Received S22 as described in timely manner but after I had paid for the item and before it was shipped I asked the seller questions but received NO response. Then I clicked the box to request Swappa assistance but they did not respond either. It was if once you paid for the item they were not interested in you ?!?Response to Swappa Reply;Thank you for your Honest reply. Godbless you and your Swappa business to continue to be honest and caring for your customers.

Review.Titre: I'm writing this review because if I…
Review.Contenu: I'm writing this review because if I don't, I'll probably keep getting emails asking me to review this site. I got the phone that I bought (no bait and switch here!) and it does what I expected it do (make phone calls, access the interwebs, etc.) So congratulations on providing a reliable service for buying used electronics

Review.Titre: Good But Not Great
Review.Contenu: Swappa needs to require sellers to take more and better pictures of their phones for sale before being allowed to complete a listing. It's lazy and rude to require buyers to ask sellers to provide additional photos, when half the time you just get ignored. Also, they need to clearly state whether or not a phone comes with a charger and cable, not just say, "charger and cable not required." Well ok, so it's not required, but is it included? Duh.

Review.Titre: You guys do not have control over…
Review.Contenu: You guys do not have control over payment process. When deals fail to go through, many customers need to wait half a month to see their refund hit the bank. Not very convenient. And your staff team are all talk and useless. All those warnings to bad sellers in comment session gets nowhere. In the end buyers need to depend on their own to seek payments back.

Review.Titre: The fee structure is very confusing for…
Review.Contenu: The fee structure is very confusing for consumers but very convenient for the marketplace to get more $$ for them with even lesser service than before. Initially swappa was too good to be true and now it's too good to look elsewhere.

Review.Titre: What happens when a buyer claims overheating?
Review.Contenu: Bought 3 used Pixel 3's to test prior to a trip to Europe as Goggle Fi works best on Goggle phones(I'm a iphone fan). So I only tested them for a day or so and kept one that seemed to have the best battery life. Sold the other two. A week or so later one of the buyers stated that after using the phone for a day or so that it overheated. I had know way of knowing whether that was true or not. Decided to just pay him back without him sending it back to me as I was leaving.  Kinda concerning whether a buy is truthful or not.

Review.Titre: I can see now why swappa uses Paypal so…
Review.Contenu: I can see now why swappa uses Paypal so that Swappa themselves don't have to deal with people not sending the item. Now people like me have to contact Paypal, file and claim which can take who knows how much time. Now I am out couple hundred dollars while I wait for Paypal to get my money back. Purchased item on May 1. Seller had till 3rd to ship. Swappa told me on 6th to contact Paypal to file claim. I have now I am playing the waiting game.

Review.Titre: Sellers don't seem serious.
Review.Contenu: With the recent 4G shutdown (I have several 4G phones in the family that were not VoLTE capable), I have needed to buy 4 phones.  Swappa's process is good, but of the 4 phones, 2 have come in and needed to be returned.  The problems were basic issues that I found within seconds of first powering up the phones.  This just causes delays and headaches.  They set everything right in the end, but these sellers claim a "30 point inspection" or whatever.

Review.Titre: Purchase experience is good
Review.Contenu: Purchase experience is good, search options on android app are just awful, if I search by Android then Att phones I get a list of random phones, not sorted by price or make or model, trying to find something specific means that have to scroll and look at every listing

Review.Titre: I love it but wish there were tighter…
Review.Contenu: I love it but wish there were tighter rules for what quantifies as Mint condition. I see lots of phones listed as Mint that are not mint at all. 80% battery life is NOT Mint. That's a heavily used phone! And the ones that don't state battery life at all?

Review.Titre: Swappa is a pretty good place to sell…
Review.Contenu: Swappa is a pretty good place to sell electronics. I wish they had a more robust condition ranking rather than mint/good/fair and require that people indicate if there are scratches and/or damage to the screen or damage to the phone body.

Review.Titre: I have been using swappa for a long…
Review.Contenu: I have been using swappa for a long time now and thought it was the fairest and best place to sell but all that has changed.  The changes made to the interface have complicated the process and it just a overall mess. You can no longer really track your views because of the quick panel. I actually used ebay for the first time in like ten years too because Swappa's price to sell have sky rocketed and are very close to ebays now. That was the big draw to swappa. But now I might as well use ebay and get far more traffic on the listing and get it sold quicker.  It's a shame that it's come to this

Review.Titre: There needs to be better buyer protection.
Review.Contenu: There needs to be better buyer protection. I bought a phone that was stolen before it was actually delivered and the seller never insured the package. I was scolded for not filing a police report (which I did) and had no resolution. I find it strange that the seller confirmed they never insured the package yet I was told I did wrong. I’m still out $900 to this day, It would be nice if larger companies could start watching out for the little guys.

Review.Titre: Great phones, horrible shopping.
Review.Contenu: The electronics you buy here do tend to meet of higher and more reliable quality standards than other online used goods markets. I have never had to return any of the 4 devices I bought, always very satisfied. However, the search tools are horrible. If you were looking for a device specifically under $130, you might have to spend a couple hours scrolling through phones that are way more expensive. I believe that is an intentional and dishonest system.

Review.Titre: The purchase and sale went fine
Review.Contenu: The purchase and sale went fine. I found the phone I wanted for a good price. The reason for the lower rating is that the seller ended up contacting me directly after the sale to release the PayPal funds to them. The phone was delivered on a Friday and on Saturday I received the first email. Sunday morning I received a second email telling me to send the phone back if I'm not going to pay. I responded that I have no control over when PayPal/Swappa releases funds and I already paid. On Monday, guess what? They got the money in their account. I think Swappa needs to make it more clear to sellers on the timing of receiving money from sales.

Review.Titre: The price is in the main page is a bit…
Review.Contenu: The price is in the main page is a bit out-dated.it is quite different from the price of each product.

Review.Titre: Unconscionable Fees
Review.Contenu: The selling my phone part was easy.  Swappa's disclosure of fees, however, was purposefully deceptive.  They do not overtly disclose that you will be whacked for a substantial "Partner Fee" when selling your personal phone.  For me, that turned out to be $31 on a $290 phone sale. Paypal fees are on top of that. Take my advice and stick to Craigslist.  I will never do business with Swappa again.

Review.Titre: Swappa
Review.Contenu: Selling on Swappa is one thing and buying products sold on swappa is quite another thing.  I do sell some of my devices on Swappa.  I personally would not buy anything on Swappa even if new.  There are many that do, most looking for a real bargain and just lowball offer on everyone's asking prices.  Most of the individuals that are officials on Swappa are nice people.  Many of the buyers I have experienced a sale with have been very happy with a device I have sold them.  Thank You Swappa.

Review.Titre: Too many fees
Review.Contenu: Too many fees, I ended up paying an extra $90 and the seller received $81 less than the price. There were no issues with the sale and i received the phone rather quickly. The staff answered questions quickly as well Taxes are unjust I feel, as the item is being traded 3rd party and Swappa is an intermediate.

Review.Titre: Good site to sell
Review.Contenu: Good site to sell. They recently upped their fees to a ridiculous amount on top of PayPal’s ridiculous fee. They don’t give you a shipping label after charging you to the ground. And until they revert the changes they won’t be my first choice again.

Review.Titre: Ordered and paid for a phone and the…
Review.Contenu: Ordered and paid for a phone and the seller backed out the next day claiming a local sale. That cost me a day.  Second purchase went well but sellers are not including the chargers and cords any more so I am considering switching to buying refurbs elsewhere. Also on my latest 3 purchases Swappa has messed up digits in the tracking number so I can't track the phone without contacting the seller directly to get the tracking number corrected. I doubt I am the only person this has happened to.

Review.Titre: Corrected Review
Review.Contenu: I stand corrected on who actually paid the taxes. IMO the details were not clarified very clearly and it appeared that it was deducted from my proceeds but I was wrong. The buyer actually paid the taxes, I guess the PayPal charge through me off. Oh well my apologies to Swappa. Still satisfied with the sale process. Would use them again just have to account for costs a little better.

Review.Titre: Everything is great until it isn't
Review.Contenu: Swappa has been great. They tend to have experienced sellers and transactions have been smooth and great. However, if something isn't going great, they tend to just close the transaction and let PayPal handle the rest. So, in reality, Swappa can't really do much...it's PayPal who has your back. Just my $0.02.

Review.Titre: Need better shipping options
Review.Contenu: Products I received are great. Many problems with shipping. There should be optional ups or fedex that the buyer can choose. I’ve have late products and a phone that was lost by usps. Now as the buyer I am out the money and no phone. Also senders do not secure boxes good enough. I piece of tape does not hold throughout the usps plants.

Review.Titre: Extremely difficult to sell a device…
Review.Contenu: Extremely difficult to sell a device for what it's worth. A few years ago there were no problems with businesses on swappa selling refurbished devices for dirt cheap without official oneplus chargers and charging blocks. Now days you have to figure out who's actually a person selling and who's a devious store front. That's the reason for 3 stars. I do however find what I want, usually at a reasonable price.

Review.Titre: A hassle to use, still a good place for gadgets
Review.Contenu: Although Swappa is still a great place to buy and sell gadgets, instead of improving the website and making it easier to navigate, it has become a hassle to use.In the past if a buyer or seller asked a question, comments were visible and it was easy to see if there was a reply. As of this day,  clicking on separate link is required to see comments. Whoever came up with that "brilliant" idea deserves to be fired. Even checking a phone's imii number which used tone simple and intuitive has been changed to a confusing mess. Swappa  has replied to my emails but pretty much have told me tough luck , nothing will be changed.

Review.Titre: 5 stars operating on 3
Review.Contenu: I love the site and prompt responses I would have given it a 5 star however there seems to be a glitch on the site where lables should be but are not there are little boxes with X in themI also have a concern with being a person who does not live in the USA and having to ask persons everytime before purchasing if they are comfortable with using a freight forwarding service is tedious and could be fixed with having a selection or an option for sellers to allow us to buy easier as I would have missed out on many deals because I had to wait for a response and the sellers did not reply fast enough and it was sold

Review.Titre: Swappa used to be a great place to sell…
Review.Contenu: Swappa used to be a great place to sell unwanted electronic devices. Easy to use, transactions really smooth, lots of transparency, etc. The problem i have with it nowadays are the fees. By the time all the swappa fees, shipping and paypal fees you almost better just trading in devices.

Review.Titre: Requires a lot of trust to use!
Review.Contenu: While like the service which connects buyer and seller I can tell vetting of sellers is minimal and they do not have any power over the seller when they behave badly other than delisting them from using the site after they have burned a buyer.  Its risky if you don't use paypal!

Review.Titre: not likely to use Swappa to sell
Review.Contenu: The seller and I had some difficulty but finally worked things out. And I am happy with the seller's service and the device is as described.That being said, before I was able to work things out with the seller, I tried to sell the device on Swappa so that I could find what I needed even if offered by another seller. Swappa was really difficult to deal with! I copied and pasted the information exactly as the device I first purchased / received from the seller; but Swappa kept saying the information was incorrect! I am not likely to try to sell anything on Swappa going forward.

Review.Titre: Two of the three purchases did not go…
Review.Contenu: Two of the three purchases did not go well. First purchase, the seller left out information and I received a refurbished piece. Then i went back and bought from a different seller that never shipped the iPad. Had to work with PayPal for a refund. Only the third seller was legit and shipped promptly. I’f have preferred to make one purchase than three for the same item. Took 3 weeks to finally get what I needed after a lot of unnecessary back and forth.

Review.Titre: Great Except for eSim Restriction
Review.Contenu: The  condition of the phone was rated good but was excellent as described by the seller in his posting. Miniscule wear evident and one very slight and short screen scatch.  Setup all but the activation prior to activation and going thru settings, found that the phone had previously benn activated on TMobile using eSim.  I use Verizon so called to setup on Esim but Verizon rep could not do so and said I needed a nano card.  Went to Verizon store to get card and they somehow acivated using eSim.  Since then, decided to switch to US Mobile using eSim on their Verizon system but they said that eSim had some kind of eSIm restriction.  They checked compatibility on their GSM system and said the phone is compatible.  Apparently the phone (verified as unlocked as described) is not truly open to all carriers via eSim which adds disappointment to dealing with Swappa.  I am waiting on a US Mobile nano card which will supposedly overcome the US Mobile Verizon eSim restriction.

Review.Titre: Smooth
Review.Contenu: Smooth, easy transaction.Statement that "the photos may not be of the actual device" is lame. Seller should be required to state that the photos are, or are not, of the actual device.Sellers should be very strongly encouraged to provide battery status. Do this by putting a red "X" in the battery status box with a footnote that says, "sellers are encouraged to provide battery status but some do not."

Review.Titre: Swappa is great. Simple!
Review.Contenu: Swappa is my preferred platform for buying and selling used phones. Listing is easy, fees are reasonable, and they diligently monitor sellers and devices, ensuring a secure experience. The friendly community adds to its appeal. Highly recommend for smartphone or tablet transactions.

Review.Titre: Repeat, satisfied customer!
Review.Contenu: I have you Swappa for many years and find it to be a great source for both purchasing and selling pre-owned devices. My only issues have been delayed delivery by US Postal Service.

Review.Titre: Seems like I just get unlucky
Review.Contenu: Seems like I just get unlucky? First phone I buy is usually a dud. Returning stuff seems common for me.I will most likely buy more phones in 2027. I will be back then and see if things have improves.Thanks!

Review.Titre: Swappa makes buying used phones easy and much safer
Review.Contenu: Swappa is the best online resource to buy tech that is not quite new.  Using Swappa minimizes the risk of buying and selling used phones for those who just want to be fair with one another.  It's the only place I will buy a used phone.

Review.Titre: Swappa still has risks and PayPal is the only power to resolve.
Review.Contenu: Swappa is great. I have had generally good experiences. And bought and sold more than 10 things. But...I realized there is still some risk, and their policies have no power to reverse a failed sale. Only PayPal or Venmo can reverse the charges. And all said, the buyer did not respond or even mail out the item. The buyer has a5 star rating, but their last sale was more than a year ago. But with the Swappa and PayPay claims processes, I was without my $353 for nearly a month after the sale ended. I did get my refund, but wish Swappa put more teeth into blatant fraud of a seller - no tracking within the mandatory 2 business days, and penalties for not following through on a sale.

Review.Titre: Easy to set up a sale and got more than trading in
Review.Contenu: Easy to set up a sale and I like that they give you recommended prices. However, the recommend price when setting up the sale was quite a bit higher than others for the same item so I had to come down some. I also wish they would disclose all fees on the sale. There was sales tax (for the buyer) and a hefty PayPal fee for the transaction that was more than their 3% sale fee. Overall though I got more than I would trading it in and the fees were still much less than eBay. I would do it again and recommend it to others.

Review.Titre: Transaction was almost perfect.
Review.Contenu: Transaction was great but the Mint Mobile SIM card I was sent was expired. It was resolved but took extra time.

Review.Titre: Good place to find quality products.
Review.Contenu: Swappa is a great place to find good products that usually work as advertised. You get what you paid for. The support staff is as good as it can get these days...which does not mean much. Their big Achilles heel is relying on PayPal as a form of payment. If things do not end up as expected and you need to get refunded, you might be on your own when dealing with PayPal.

Review.Titre: Reuse! Don’t landfill!
Review.Contenu: My third iPad purchase and can still count on Swappa to get quality at affordable prices as well as vetting sellers for reliability, so helps me upgrade without breaking the bank.  Recently purchased a new older iPad and pricing not as competitive as use to be but still like the base idea of helping us better reuse good items and breaking us of our throwaway mentality.

Review.Titre: Phone arrived as advertised and works.
Review.Contenu: Phone I bought arrived quickly and as described. It is working.I only gave 4 stars because another phone I really wanted was not available. That is really not swappa's fault as they can't magically produce phones for sale but it was nevertheless a bit disappointing for me.The ordering and receiving and comments on the website all worked well, as expected.

Review.Titre: Everything went ok except the package…
Review.Contenu: Everything went ok except the package got delayed at a USPS facility for a few days. Then it went on a tour of the Atlantic northeast before finally arriving at my door. The seller was in constant contact and tried to expedite as much as possible. Overall a good transaction. 3rd phone I've purchased on swappa.

Review.Titre: Good place to get a phone, skip the free mint mobile
Review.Contenu: Buying the used phone was great. The Three months with mint mobile ended up being useless because I couldn't activate the Sim card I was sent, even with tech support. Basically, the mint/ swappa compatibility isn't there.  I'm not too concerned about the lost money there, I'm just kind of annoyed I didn't know what was going on the whole day.

Review.Titre: Four transactions, three great one not
Review.Contenu: Four transactions, three were fantastic, one unsatisfactory. The key is to rely on the classification of fair, good or mint, not the written descriptions or photos.  Do not rely solely on reviews of sellers, swappa removes negative reviews if seller asks them to.

Review.Titre: Experience is great
Review.Contenu: Experience is great. Charges and taxes are more which can be brought down. But genuine buyers and sellers.  Reviewed ad posts. Thanks!

Review.Titre: It's good that SWAPPA is strict about…
Review.Contenu: It's good that SWAPPA is strict about sellers listings, and buyer's protection from scammers. I'm not sure if they require it, but they must make sure that NEW items have "proof of purchase" by the sellers, so no HOT items are listed to protect buyers from buying stolen items.

Review.Titre: Swappa is easy to use, but there was an issue with the transaction
Review.Contenu: Swappa is easy to use and I sold my old phone quickly. Their instructions for how to prepare the phone before sending it and the fact that the money came through PayPal made me feel confident in my choice to use Swappa. I did have an issue that arose from the transaction however. Although it was technically a PayPal issue, Swappa is aware of the issue and I don’t recall seeing a warning about it. Due to the “risky” nature of selling and buying electronics via PayPal, my PayPal account was permanently frozen, with the funds from the sale of my phone held and unavailable to me for 6 months. After an internet search, this is not uncommon with Swappa transactions. It would have been nice to get a heads up from Swappa that this was a possibility. My phone was older, bit having closer to $1000 held by PayPal would have been really disappointing.

Review.Titre: I am using swappa for a long time
Review.Contenu: I am using swappa for a long time. This time one of the seller lied and posted wrong information and sold the mobile with me. The mobile was not as described and he was not answering the questions because he sold the phone with wrong info. So I suggest swappa to take a strong rule to those seller and help buyer if they face such kind of thing. Helping buyer will build up more trust to buyer towards swappa and swappa should resolve those problem within short period of time.                                                                                Other than that I have good experince with swappa.

Review.Titre: Great for buying used apple products
Review.Contenu: Great for buying used apple products! People are required to submit quality pictures. Sellers are often very responsive.My only gripe is that (1) I dont get emails when sellers make comments on a sales page so I have to keep that tab open and refresh and (2) I wish they didnt have so many listings from device pools--I prefer buying from an actual seller

Review.Titre: Be more strict in approving listings
Review.Contenu: They need to be more strict about the details of the phones they approve to be listed. The person I bought from said that there were no scratches on the phone I bought. When it arrived I saw two large scratches and like a hundred micro scratches on the screen. The photos were not that clear either. Why would Swappa approve of that? In the end, I cleaned the phone thoroughly and somehow got to remove more of the screen scratches by using products.

Review.Titre: Product was as advertised and the…
Review.Contenu: Product was as advertised and the filters available really helped a lot.

Review.Titre: Fees are a little steep, but great overall experience.
Review.Contenu: The fees have gotten a little steep since Swappa first started (I’ve been using it for 11 years), but overall it’s one of the best online marketplaces for used tech. Staff is always helpful and the verification processes make sure no one gets ripped off. Highly recommended.

Review.Titre: You'll make less than you expect
Review.Contenu: The buyer was charged $675.09. My seller payout says that I should have received $583.94 after the buyer fee, seller fee, state taxes, etc. but I only received $549.76. I'm not really sure why this happened but it was very disappointing because that essentially doubled my expected loss when you include the crazy shipping costs I had to take care of myself because Swappa offers free shipping to customers and my customer lived literally on the opposite coast of the country. I'm still mostly satisfied though I guess.Edit to respond:During the process of listing and selling my item there was nothing that mentioned I would lose money to a PayPal fee.

Review.Titre: The only hiccup in this process…
Review.Contenu: The only hiccup in this process involved the United Postal Service.  They temporarily lost the device which delayed the delivery by over a week.  Other than that, we were happy to finally receive the phone :)

Review.Titre: Good shopping experience
Review.Contenu: Shipping time was slow by seller but product was like new. Seller pics were very poor quality but took the chance for pice sake. Like I said earlier it was in like new condition and it was unlocked as described.  Using Swappa was easy and overall felt like a safe e-commerce experience.  They do charge tax, by law,which felt painful but thats just that. Good experience minus slow shipping out out time.

Review.Titre: Great for used phones and trade-ins
Review.Contenu: I've bought 3 devices and traded 2 in to Swappa and its trade-in partners. Other than a few minor hiccups with trade-in value and a speaker on a Galaxy S9 that blew several months later (not really their fault) I've had an excellent experience.

Review.Titre: I love the product, slow shipping
Review.Contenu: Overall I’m pleased with my Swappa experience. I ordered and received a good working phone at a great price. The purchase was simple and straight forward, without any surprise charges etc. I took off 1 star because the shipping took 6 days. That is significant deviation from what is advertised for shipping time.

Review.Titre: Good for buyers, less good for sellers
Review.Contenu: It's a good experience, and I'd definitely buy things on Swappa.  However, for sellers, Swappa has instituted a 'star' system in which you pay extra to have your listing appear at the top (even if someone has sorted on price).

Review.Titre: Great used merchandise at a great price and issues are rectified easily
Review.Contenu: I purchased a Google Pixel 6 Pro from one seller on Swappa. The phone was delivered 3 days after the purchase was made. Unfortunately, the phone was damaged during shipment. The members of the Swappa support team were helpful with the return and receiving a full refund.After the refund was issued, I tried again with a second seller. The second seller was great, delivering the Google Pixel 6 Pro in 2 days and the phone's condition is the same as it was described. I paid about $175 less than a refurbished phone through other large retailers.I highly recommend Swappa

Review.Titre: Good Service, just Bad Payment Experience
Review.Contenu: I like how simple it is to buy and the amount of people using the service to sell. I just don't like if you say have an issue with payment (i.e. thinking you're using PayPal Payin4 option or new monthly payments but doesn't notify you're not eligible and get charged full amount) or have 2nd thoughts you're stuck with the purchase for the most part.

Review.Titre: Simple to use, great for selling mobile devices
Review.Contenu: Simple, straight forward, consistent posting process. Timely review and approval by Swappa staff. This may be fixed by now, but in the past many of my transactions still show up as Active even though they've been completed for months. If buyers don't do their part to confirm/close out the transaction, Swappa should have an automated process that changes the status from Active to Completed after 30 days or less.

Review.Titre: It was my first time purchasing an item…
Review.Contenu: It was my first time purchasing an item from this website, and the seller of the item was total supportive of my concerns, and even got the item to me faster than expected.  I really Loved the service.  I'm fully enjoying my S22 Ultra

Review.Titre: Phones had issues but sellers promptly handled the situation
Review.Contenu: I ordered 2 phones from 2 different vendors. Both phone had issues. One phone had network and blue tooth issues and the other phone was not unlocked as it was advertised but rather tied to a carrier. In both instances, the sellers handled the issues right away and sent me a return label so I applaud the sellers for their prompt action. The only reason for the 4 star is the inconveniences (i.e. spending hours with tech support with my carrier trying to narrow down the network issues and having to make 2 trips to the post office).

Review.Titre: CS downhill, but still my go-to place to buy.
Review.Contenu: Customer service is not as good as it once was. Questions often are answered incompletely or just pointed to slightly dated FAQs.There are too many corporate-style sellers that use stock photos (which, for used items, is unhelpful) and overall the descriptions are also rather pat and stock.However, the swappa philosophy about making sure all parties are treated fairly remains untarnished.

Review.Titre: Samsung S22 Ultra purchase
Review.Contenu: Dealing directly with the buyer... Open line of communication from transaction start to finish and with Swappa admin ability to monitor the entire sale/purchase event... This open comm helps to suggest improvements to all parties.  Sugg to Swappa - Need to require all shipments by all parties to be up to standard since  electronic eqipmts are very fragile & filferable...

Review.Titre: The company is doing great in terms of…
Review.Contenu: The company is doing great in terms of making sure the devices are genuine. I will request if there is some rebate on taxes because the price go very high with taxes.

Review.Titre: Worth giving a chance
Review.Contenu: I was very skeptical at first, but I got the phone in the condition it was as advertised & was able to verify everything matched. The packaging for when it got shipped could’ve been better, but nonetheless great stuff.

Review.Titre: This purchase went well but be very…
Review.Contenu: This purchase went well but be very careful because if you have problems, it’s not as easy as you’d think to get help.

Review.Titre: Make the shipping address more prominent
Review.Contenu: Swappa made it easy to find a great device at a reasonable price.  My only complaint was Swappa populated my eBay checkout with an old address that I did not notice until 5 minutes after checking out.  There was no way for me to update that without the seller offering a refund and relisting the device.  The seller was great to work with though.

Review.Titre: Great place to sell items but understand what you'll pay in fees, taxes and shipping.
Review.Contenu: My Item sold within two weeks. I like that the seller gets paid before the Item is shipped. My only advice to sellers is to really figure out what your actual net payment will be. I think it’s essential to put all the fees, taxes, and shipping costs on paper to really see what the actual cost of doing business is. When you’re done with the fees, taxes, and shipping costs, the difference between what the buyer ends up paying and the net payment I received as the seller was around 30%.

Review.Titre: It was a great experience for me a…
Review.Contenu: It was a great experience for me a first time seller/user on Swappa, everything was well thought out and explained. From providing pictures of the overall device, a device description, an area for tracking the device etc.

Review.Titre: Swappa's platform makes it worthwhile…
Review.Contenu: Swappa's platform makes it worthwhile to both buyers and sellers by offering neat, concise information about what you are shopping for. Search, to purchase to receiving purchases is efficient.

Review.Titre: Prompt shipment
Review.Contenu: Prompt shipment.  Phone was in great physical shape for only fair condition.  However battery only had 65% capacity.   Seller refunded my purchase.

Review.Titre: Trustworthy but has issues
Review.Contenu: Site is trustworthy i bought a phone and got it just as it was described, 4 stars because the website shows "featured"offers first and in a lowest price first order and it tricked me into thinking the first phone on the list was the cheapest when it wasn't and there was a bunch of cheaper options if u scroll down till you get to the non featured offers, the website needs to have some sort of warning or something that indicates what featured options are as right now i would consider the way the offers are ordered predatory for new swappa users.

Review.Titre: I love the straightforward nature of…
Review.Contenu: I love the straightforward nature of buyer and seller making the transaction. I've bought multiple phones through Swappa (probably 4 or 5) and it's always been a great experience. I only put 4 stars because this time it did seem like I had to sift through a few sellers that were not listing the code the way Swappa says you need to. That lead me to believe there was something suspicious with that listing, like it may have been someone buying and selling phones in bulk which I don't believe is in line with what Swappa wants.

Review.Titre: Okay
Review.Contenu: It was ok, i would have preferrred faster postal sevice by swappa as you guys are taking a cut in sales anyway.

Review.Titre: The undisclosed "partner fee"
Review.Contenu: The undisclosed "partner fee" that was charged, and I don't even understand, who is the partner, was nearly 15% of the sale price on a cell phone I sold. This is very shady, as it was never discussed on swappa site regarding fees, where they simply disclose a buyer and seller fee, plus PayPal fee. All of the disclosed fees amount to less than 10% were misrepresented, as disclosed fees were 6.49% to the seller.

Review.Titre: Loving how easy it is to sell devices…
Review.Contenu: Loving how easy it is to sell devices on here, but it's been a long time since I have and now I see fees are out of this world higher than back then. But it's a business.

Review.Titre: Easy to communicate with seller
Review.Contenu: Easy to communicate with seller. Staff are responsive to request. One star off because PayPal wasn’t working with it one time and I never got an explanation why. I had to use Venmo.

Review.Titre: Simple to use site and responsive team…
Review.Contenu: Simple to use site and responsive team when they need additional information. Items sell pretty quickly when priced right for the market. Their pricing scales are helpful too so you have a good idea of what you will get.While swappa fees are reasonable, you have to add that, shipping and PayPal fees all up to know what your net is. It would be a 5 star if the system gave you that full estimate up front.

Review.Titre: Overall a good first experience with…
Review.Contenu: Overall a good first experience with SWAPPA.  However, I had questions that I wanted to ask the seller regarding the product before I purchased.  When I clicked on contact seller, I wasn't able to ask my questions.  One of my questions was whether it had a SIM card or not (it didn't).  The description said that it was kept in an Otterbox case while they used it - I wanted to ask if I could buy that case too, but I couldn't ask.  So, if you could make it possible to contact sellers BEFORE making a purchase, that would be very helpful.  But, I saved a lot of money by buying on SWAPPA versus new, Thank you!

Review.Titre: I am pleased with the condition of my…
Review.Contenu: I am pleased with the condition of my purchase. The quality of the pictures describing my item could have been better. In addition, if I had known that the seller was not able to ship my item within two days of my purchase, I would not have purchased it. Please consider notifying potential buyers when that is the case.

Review.Titre: I really liked using Swappa for…
Review.Contenu: I really liked using Swappa for purchasing a newer iPhone. The first iPhone 12pro I ordered was canceled before it shipped to me because it had some damage. I was able to simply be refunded on that one and then ordered another one which passed their inspection standards. I also saved a pile of money on this new phone!

Review.Titre: Brand new Galaxy Tab A7
Review.Contenu: I've purchased just about every cellphone for our family through Swappa over the past 8 years.  Good prices,  great service from private sellers or other vendors.  Another great experience.

Review.Titre: Swappa changes
Review.Contenu: It’s been a while since I sold something on swappa. I don’t ever remember having as much trouble at finding what I needed in the past. I definitely missed the no seller fee and option to sell local. Other than that using swappa is all good

Review.Titre: Good service and response, phone not checked out thoroughly before selling though.
Review.Contenu: The phone arrived looking in great near mint condition, but the battery didn't work.  The seller did give me a refund without any fuss.

Review.Titre: Swappa is a fantastic site with some suggestions...
Review.Contenu: Swappa is a fantastic site to sell electronics for an above average return.  However, I'd like to see the total net amount earned including updated PayPal fees.  Also, a notification of competitor prices above/below/same your listing would be very nice.

Review.Titre: The best place to buy a used phone is definitely on Swappa.
Review.Contenu: Every time I've purchased a phone on Swappa, I get exactly what is advertised. No dishonesty, no scams, just a good working phone. The best place to buy a used phone is definitely on Swappa.

Review.Titre: Swappa is great, but wary of business sellers
Review.Contenu: Most of the time, you don't need any help, but when you do, someone from the Swappa staff will respond in no time.I will only comment on my experience with a "business" seller (ones that do this as a gig).  The phone was defective so I had to return it, but the seller was unresponsive for days and only responded when I asked Swappa for help. I just hope this is not the norm with other "business" sellers.

Review.Titre: The products are always well organized…
Review.Contenu: The products are always well organized with simple to use filters.  I would have liked a quicker response to my questions from seller. The fact that there is a disclaimer from commercial sellers that one may not see the actual product for sale is an issue for me.

Review.Titre: Nice phones; would like like customer-focused experience.
Review.Contenu: I like the selection of phones; however, I wish the pics are of the actual phones that are on sale. I also wish we can comment and ask sellers about the product if needed without having to send them a message and hopefully get a reply.

Review.Titre: This experience with swappa rated great for me…
Review.Contenu: This experience  is rated great for me because every time i had a question or requested a call the swappa team was right there anxious to assist,and gave me an every day update from the tenth right up untill about the 25th ,even when my texts went bad because of typos they understood, and made me feel welcomed/relaxed.

Review.Titre: Used to be able to communicate directly…
Review.Contenu: Used to be able to communicate directly with seller much more easily. Sellers should not be able to post pictures that look "similar"to product, actual product photos only.

Review.Titre: Excellent deals on phones, look elsewhere for other tech.
Review.Contenu: Swappa has been my go-to website for used phones for the past decade. I feel like I've always gotten the best deals for used Android phones from anywhere around, and they have excellent customer support. I always feel safe when purchasing with Swappa.Sellers are vetted and motivated and ship quickly, and the site is organized in a way to where if you need a specific model (like for CDMA Verizon only) it's very easy to filter and narrow down.However, on non-phone items I've found other sites (particularly eBay and Amazon) to be much better deals. For example, smartwatches. There seems to be a large premium on Swappa for those for some reason.The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is due to an odd scenario that I've found where Swappa links up with a big reseller and doesn't make them post the individual photos of the item with the timestamp/code. They just say that you will get an item that is representative of the stock photos they have. From my understanding, if you are a small time seller or individual you still must provide the photos of the actual item. Thankfully, I've always gotten phones that are representative of the example pictures. But I would rather they require the big sellers to show the individual items.

Review.Titre: Overall I’ve had good experience with…
Review.Contenu: Overall I’ve had good experience with Swappa!  My one reservation is an issue I had due to somewhat blurry lines in the description of the conditions of phones.  Under the description of “Good” it lists excellent as a descriptor.  The next step up from good is mint.  The phone I ordered was listed as good, but when it came, it was definitely not “excellent”…hence my issue.  I think it would be clearer to have good, excellent, and then mint conditions instead of excellent being a descriptor of a phones listed as good…it’s confusing and led to a more drawn out complicated purchasing process.

Review.Titre: Very simple buying process
Review.Contenu: Very simple buying process, product was as described. I do wish the business sellers would be required to submit photos of the device that they're selling, rather than me trusting them.

Review.Titre: Customer service is outstanding!
Review.Contenu: Swappa is the best place to buy a used smartphone or computer. I've been using Swappa for almost two years now, and it has always been a good experience for me. The site is easy to use and the customer service team is helpful when needed.

Review.Titre: The product is great
Review.Contenu: The product is great, but, there is a little connective interface conflict that requires a little extra effort to charge with a cord. Because the iPhone charges wirelessly it is not a major problem.

Review.Titre: Previously...
Review.Contenu: Previously, Staffers should be neutral on sales and help to ensure their NO JUNK NO JERKS...   My last experience went without any issues at all.  Thanks Swappa !

Review.Titre: Good tech marketplace
Review.Contenu: Vendor did not accept credit cards - paypal only. Found the mobile phone product I wanted in excellent condition with the provider I needed.

Review.Titre: Great experience with getting the phone…
Review.Contenu: Great experience with getting the phone and it is perfect. The only thing I would change is to have more filters to search by such as manufacturer, RAM, etc.

Review.Titre: This is the 2nd time I have ordered a…
Review.Contenu: This is the 2nd time I have ordered a phone from Swappa. The first time was a great experience. This time would have been except my phone went to the wrong address. I used PayPal and realized as soon as I submitted my order the address was my old one. I immediately contacted PayPal and Swappa and sent them the correct address. They both acted like it was up to the other as to where my phone would be shipped. The phone was shipped to the old address. It did get forwarded thankfully but took over a week to get. I don’t understand why it seemed to be so difficult to change the address when I contacted them both immediately. I’m glad to have the phone and it seems great.

Review.Titre: Great marketplace with a couple minor annoyances.
Review.Contenu: Swappa's got a great marketplace, with a couple minor kinks that could be improved.  The verification of sellers and the focus on having high quality merchandise is great, both as a seller and as a buyer.  The customer service is stellar.  Any time I've had a question or an issue (and I have), the Swappa staff is very, very fast to respond with clear, helpful support.  The things that annoy me are that international buyers still get through and you can get slapped with a surprise international fee from PayPal.  This happened on my very first sale and it was a minor headache to sort out, but it worked out in the end.  Speaking of PayPal, that's my second gripe.  Give me more options, with better fees, for managing my payments.  And finally, when I'm listing something, I'd love to not have a public comment area where people make lowball offers.  Let people make offers, but keep it private to me (or at least give me that as an option).

Review.Titre: Phone was physically as described
Review.Contenu: Phone was physically as described in Good Condition. However, the compatibility for Visible wireless was not as advertised and for this reason I give 4 Stars. Also, the IMEI number for the phone was not listed in the advertisement which I believe all sellers should post, could have saved me some time, but seller took full responsibility for the Visible compatibility advertisement error. I decided to keep the phone because it was nice and priced at a savings. Fortunately, I was able to find another compatible wireless carrier that met my needs. My phone is now activated by my new wireless carrier and is working just fine. Overall, this ended up being a good experience for me. Hopefully, the phone will last me for quite some time. I will use Swappa in the future, but before purchasing, make sure I get the IMEI number from seller whether listed or not.

Review.Titre: Quick shipping Good phone Good value
Review.Contenu: Quick shipping.  The phone works just fine. The only issue is that it looks like the battery is not an Apple battery and Apple being jerks won't let the phone show battery health.  If the battery is fairly new not a problem.  If it becomes an issue I'll go to Apple and get a "correct" battery.  Overall the phone work just fine at a fraction of the price of a new phone.  Will buy from them again.

Review.Titre: 4 iphones xr
Review.Contenu: All company ships fast, the price is cheaper than others websites. I bougth 4 iphones, one in mint condition and 3 in good condition, and only one has desapointed me. in my experience, Wcell company were the best company

Review.Titre: It was a great purchase
Review.Contenu: It was a great purchase, not perfect though, the phone had a little bit more scratches on the screen than described on the listing, but other than that it was great. The price was good as well. I received the phone well packed in a couple of days. Quick and painless online purchase, highly recommended site.

Review.Titre: Fair and safe
Review.Contenu: Overall experience was excellent. One point that I would prefer addressed site has very vague, non-specific descriptions for phone condition. I think, for total transparency, more detailed descriptions of damage Would be helpful and making decisions between items on swappa. For instance, the phone that I purchased was listed in good condition, which states that there is normal, wear and tear on the phone. Seller did not have pictures of the exact phone being sold, but it’s stock picture of a phone that would be in a “similar condition” stock picture did not have any visible wear and tear. The phone I received had a deep scratch in the middle of the front screen and two cracks on the lower rear camera. The deep scratch is short. And the two cracks do not interfere with the picture quality. Overall, I am satisfied with my experience. And believe I got a fair price for the condition the phone was in. And I will be using this site again to purchase Tech in the future.

Review.Titre: Used and refurbished tech is best sold…
Review.Contenu: Used and refurbished tech is best sold on Swappa. Swappa sold me many iPhones and laptops in good condition. The sellers were pleasant and helpful, and shipping was speedy and free. Swappa has excellent support. Swappa is a great method to buy new tech safely and easily.

Review.Titre: IPhone purchases
Review.Contenu: IPhone purchases. I can always find what I am looking for quickly and easily. I do wish on phones that battery Health be required in all descriptions.

Review.Titre: Trustworthy Place for Electronics
Review.Contenu: I really enjoy most everything Swappa does. I love that listings are verified before they can be posted, so it's more likely my purchase is from someone honest.I don't like that businesses can be run from an "individual" account--if someone has posted more than a dozen listings per year, they shouldn't be able to qualify as "individual". Especially because, when I search for "individual", I'm looking for people who are selling their own devices. I want that added familiarity with the device, so when I ask questions they are able to answer, etc. Not someone mass-marketing devices.I also really wish Swappa required a bit more information and pictures for a listing. For an unlocked phone, I'd like to know who the original carrier company it was made for was, as some phones have different bands they operate on, and just because it is "unlocked" doesn't necessarily mean it will operate as well on other carrier networks. I also think pictures to verify certain things should be required--such as battery capacity or original carrier. I know we are allowed to return/refund transactions that aren't what they claim, but that could wind up being a huge hassle, when all it would take are a couple extra images to verify.

Review.Titre: Nothing between mint and good?
Review.Contenu: The product came, and I am happy with it, but it wasn't in mint condition as described. I don't think this is the seller's fault, since the only other option was "good." It was too nice to be in good condition, but not free of any wear and tear (I attached pictures for the seller) Still, everything else was pretty smooth. It would be nice to have a very good section.

Review.Titre: Cost and ease
Review.Contenu: I'm getting better at taking photos and writing. The price of doing business with Swappa is not so high, but with PayPal fees and shipping I was disappointed.

Review.Titre: We are very happy with the cell phone…
Review.Contenu: We are very happy with the cell phone and appreciated the good service. The only thing that keeps SWAPPA from getting 4 stars was the fact that the wrong cord for charging was sent, so we had to scramble here to find the right cord.

Review.Titre: There was an issue with my order and it…
Review.Contenu: There was an issue with my order and it was not delivered, after reaching out to the seller via the site and directly, they assured me they will send another device and they did.

Review.Titre: I got what I wanted
Review.Contenu: I got what I wanted, great product. Just wish I would have known the factory screen protectors had been removed so I could have bought new ones before I received the phone. Not a big deal just would have been great if it was in the description.

Review.Titre: Safe experience
Review.Contenu: Everything turned out very well, it was very easy to sell my phone, it took me just 1 day from the publication, I liked the fact of secure payment with Pay Pal, it is a recommendable experience.

Review.Titre: Navigation could be better
Review.Contenu: Had all the info but could be a little more intuitive or organized

Review.Titre: Great phones at a reasonable price!
Stayed with Circa…had phone with them…
Review.Contenu: Stayed with Circa…had phone with them before as suggested by a friend. Mint condition as stated. Excellent experience as before.

Review.Titre: Phone condition good
Review.Contenu: Phone is in the condition that was described but it took a while to get here because of issues with delivery company but overall good product.

Review.Titre: It was fun I enjoy using Swappa but fix…
Review.Contenu: It was fun I enjoy using Swappa but fix the shipping please I know you like don't control that but like there's gotta be something

Review.Titre: Website is seamless and less cluttered…
Review.Contenu: Website is seamless and less cluttered than similar websites like ebay with no frills on prices, bids.The only bit I do not like is the seller fees. So if am a seller, I do not like their steep fees. They could reduce a bit to ease and be competitive.

Review.Titre: Process was easy and quick
Review.Contenu: Process was easy and quick. Only issue was that the actual fees that were charged were higher than initially estimated.

Review.Titre: Overall I love the new look and easy…
Review.Contenu: Overall I love the new look and easy way to filter out what I’m looking for. I recommend this website to all of my friends that are looking for a used phones in very good shape.

Review.Titre: Excellent deals available with good…
Review.Contenu: Excellent deals available with good sellers and buyers. The community is great

Review.Titre: Swappa sells phones and computers well
Review.Contenu: Swappa sells phones and computers well. Their rigorous verification process ensures that all devices on their platform are in good condition and priced fairly. Its easy-to-use interface and excellent customer service make it a trustworthy online transaction option.

Review.Titre: Smooth business transaction
Review.Contenu: Smooth business transaction.  I think there should be communication between the seller and buyer; when the product has shipped.

Review.Titre: Good but no perfect.

Review.Titre: My Go-To for USED tech that feels NEW!
Review.Contenu: This is from a buyer's perspective, not a seller. Whenever I see a piece of tech that I want, but I feel like I can find a better deal elsewhere, I ALWAYS go back to Swappa. Unlike Amazon or Walmart, where sellers of refurbished items use polished, generic product pictures for their used tech, Swappa sellers are required to use their own pictures and SEVERAL at that. If the product has a ding, scratch, or crack, you'll know about it. Of course, there are many products in 'Mint' condition as well, if you like that feeling of opening a product for the first time.I've bought an iPhone, iPad, Samsung tablet and even a Nintendo Switch. Sometimes from sellers that (dun dun DUNN...) didn't even have reviews...or profile pictures, at that. We've all read the eBay horror stories; rocks in boxes--the works, but Swappa is different. I didn't have any issues with any of these purchases, and all devices work, even the used iPhone, 2+ years later.Swappa is easy to navigate and organize. Only two downsides: sometimes the deals are too good that they disappear in a flash and there is not THAT much of product variety beyond phones/tablets. That's no fault of theirs, just a sad lil' note from someone who is tech obsessed. And still, you can still find other things like consoles/cameras/shoes, apparently? Hopefully, as they gain popularity, a bigger variety of tech will be offered on a consistent basis. But whatever they are doing to maintain this level of trustworthiness and reliability between their sellers and buyers, don't stop.
